The business started with one cow received as a wedding gift now brings around 5,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and meat products. Today Salkynai's business has two cows, 30 sheep and one horse. With the purpose to further grow her business Salkynai has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som to buy 27 heads of sheep. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further expand her business activity by selling food products.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Zattar

texts.ru: Заттар  53 года, вдова, мать 9 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Заттар  10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Заттар, ее поголовье насчитывает  3 дойных коров, 10 овец, 1 бычка и 2 лошадей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Заттар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Заттар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – купить дом в городе.
texts.en: Zattar is 53 years old, she is a widow and a mother of nine children. As a source of income for her family Zattar started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 10,000 som (KGS) now brings around 10,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Zattar's business has three milk cows, ten sheep, one calf and two horses. With the purpose to further grow her business Zattar has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of the headcount of cattle and in the future to buy a house in the city.

loans.use: to purchase calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 43 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Элмира 10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, ее поголовье насчитывает 2 дойной коровы, 15 овец, 3 козы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы и теленка. Доходы Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и расширение сарая для скота.
texts.en: Elmira is 43 years old, she is married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Elmira started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 20,000 som (KGS) now brings around 8,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Elmira's business has two milk cows, fifteen sheep and three goats. With the purpose to further grow her business Elmira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy a milk cow and a calf. She plans to invest the income from the loan to further increase of the headcount of cattle and to expand the shed space for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
“Medalla Milagrosa “fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el 3°ciclo con 16 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras. Ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también hacen actividades en conjunto, para que de esa forma puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La señora Ma. Angelica es una de las miembros, y nos comenta que se unió al grupo con mucha esperanza de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y dice que tiene muy buena clientela siempre, lo que la ayuda a tener buenos ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de otoño, pues ya se acerca la estación y quiere surtir su stock. Está agradecida a la fundación y a kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Medalla Milagrosa Committee is currently in its third loan cycle.  The group is comprised of sixteen responsible and hard-working women.  They are engaged in various activities but they also participate in activities together in order to support each other.  

Angelica is one of the members, and she tells us that she joined this group with high hopes of getting ahead so that she would be able to support her family and provide them with their daily needs. Angelica sells all types of clothing and says that she has always has good customers, and this enables her to earn good income.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fall clothing as this season is approaching and she wishes to stock her business.  She is grateful to the foundation and Kiva for the support that she is receiving

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Sra. Fabiola  tiene 26 años no es casada pero es madre soltera tiene un hijo que es de la edad de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de  comida ella vive por la zona de Pentaguazu, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, Fabiola  utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que incremento su clientela y necesita darles comodidad a sus clientela, también la razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio. Fabiola  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el mercado ya que la venta de comida se realiza por todos lados y utilizara los beneficios compra de enseres para el negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Fabiola  es poder comprarse un terreno, La Sra. Fabiola es una persona joven y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Fabiola, 26, is not married and is a single mother to a four year old son. She lives in the zone of Pentaguazu and works selling food. This is her second loan with the institution, and she will use it to buy tables and chairs for her business because her clientele has increased and she needs to give them more comfort. She also asked for a loan to help her business grow. Fabiola faces challenges like competition in the market, because people are selling food all over the place, and she will use the profits to buy materials for the business. Her wish is to be able to buy some land. Fabiola is young and hardworking, and she's happy and grateful to the institution for the support they've given her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Bumaira

texts.ru: Бумайре 41 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей.  В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Бумайра 10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,500 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи  молочных и мясных  продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Бумайры, ее поголовье насчитывает 10 голов крупного рогатого скота, 10 овец, 1 лошадь. Также, Бумайра обрабатывает 2,0 га собственной орошаемой земли , где выращивает фасоль и 1,0 га арендованной с картофелем. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бумайра обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма, закуп селитры для удобрения земли и семян элитного картофеля. Доходы Бумайра планирует вложить в расширение сарая для скота и внешней отделки жилого дома.
texts.en: Bumaira is 41 years old, she is married and has four children. As a source of income for her family Bumaira started doing animal husbandry ten years ago. The business started with 20,000 som (KGS) now brings around 5,500 KGS a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Through hard work Bumaira's business has ten heads of large horned cattle, ten sheep and one horse. Also Bumaira cultivates 2,0 hectares of her own arable land where she grows beans and 1,0 hectare of rented land with potatoes. With the purpose to further grow her business Bumaira has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som to buy two calves for fattening, ammonium nitrate to fertilize the land and seeds of premium potatoes. She plans to invest the income from the loan to expand the shed space for the cattle and to do cosmetic repairs of inside of her house.

loans.use: to purchase calves, potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Noudonangnon Group

texts.fr: NOUDONANGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Gilberte (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un certain Alexandre. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gilberte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gilberte vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de vingt cinq ans, Gilberte  vend de maïs, du charbon de bois et du sucre dans sa région au Benin. Gilberte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  C’est la troisième fois que Gilberte et les autres membres du groupe NOUDONANGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Noudonangnon group  includes three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Gilberte (raising her hand in the photo) is 47 years old. Her husband's name is Alexandre. They have four dependent children, all in school. Gilberte did not attend school. Gilberte lives together with her husband and children and together with her husband provides for various family needs. For about 25 years, Gilbert has been selling corn, charcoal and sugar in her region of Benin. Giberte stocks up at one of Benin's markets. Gilberte and the other members of the Noudonangnon group are seeking their third loan from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and their business, and better respond to customer demand. Their prior loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and charcoal.

loans.name: Las Pedrozeñas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son  de la ciudad de  Caacupé, se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, ya en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son todas amigas y vecinas del barrio y son destacadas por su trabajo en conjunto y ayuda entre ellas.
Cynthia se dedica a la venta de joyas, y comenta que vende todo tipo de ellas, como ser cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aros y demás. Tiene una buena cantidad de clientes, ya que tiene buen precio y forma accesible para pagar. Comenta que empezó de a poco, pero que después de mucho esfuerzo ha logrado ir creciendo y salir adelante. Su meta es seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de joyas, con lo cual puede tener siempre buena variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women of Las Pedrozeñas Group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are working comfortably, already in the second cycle of Fundación Paraguaya’s women entrepreneurs program.  They are all friends and neighbors from the barrio and are known for working together and helping each other.  

Cynthia sells all types of jewelry including chains, rings, bracelets, hoops, and other items.  She has a good number of customers as she offers good prices and convenient payment options.  She says that she began with very little, but after much hard work, she grew the business and got ahead.  Her goal is to continue working and helping her family.  She is requesting the loan to purchase jewelry so that she will always have a wide variety of goods to offer her customers

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujer Unidas"se originó a traves de promociones realizadas en el barrio. Todas las mujeres son de la misma zona. El objetivo del grupo es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa por medio del trabajo de todas ellas.
La sra. Aurora es la  Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja en la cría y venta de pollos y cerdos. Su deseo es que su grupo se fortalezca y que juntas puedan seguir trabajando por el bienestar del mismo.  En cuanto a su trabajo nos dice que le va bien, ya que tiene clientes fijos que compran de ella los animales que cría.
En miras a seguir trabajando solicita el crédito, para que pueda comprar balanceados para sus animales, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee "Mujeres Unidas" started because of advertisements in the neighborhood where all of the women live. The group's goal is to work, encourage a spirit of solidarity, and to reach the highest level of the program through all of their efforts.

Aurora is the president of the group. She raises and sells chickens and pigs. She wants her group to become strong so that together they can keep working for their own well-being. She tells us that her work goes well because she has fixed clientele that buy the animals that she raises.

In view of continuing her work, she asks for a loan to buy balanced feed for her animals, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Remigio Leguizamon

texts.es:
El Sr. Remigio tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañado con la señora Mercedes de 51 años de edad, ellos tiene 3 hijos, los tres están cursando sus estudios secundarios.
Don Remigio se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida,  hace  aproximadamente 6 años que se dedica a esto, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela y un poco de experiencia en el ramo. Comenzó con el capital que ahorraba prestando servicios de taxi, en un primer momento abrieron su negocio con su esposa a la par que el seguía con su trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás. El agradece la oportunidad de progreso que recibe y dice que no defraudara la confianza.
texts.en:
Remigio is 45 years old; he is accompanied by Mercedes, age 51, and they have three children. All three attend high school. 

Remigio is in sales. He has a small grocery store which is well stocked. It's been about six years since he got into this business, so he has a good customer base and a little experience in the industry. He started with capital that he had saved offering taxi services, and at the first opportunity he opened his business with his wife. At the same time he continued with his work. 

He's requesting this loan to buy basic necessity items to stock his store, such as foodstuffs, drinks, and dairy products, among other things. He appreciates the confidence and opportunity to get ahead that he's received, and he says that he won't disappoint.

loans.use: to buy goods, such as food, drinks and dairy products, for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Antonia tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos en edad escolar, por quienes ella siempre lucha. Esta señora es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de ropa de hilo que ella misma fabrica con su máquina y otros productos, pero también aparte de eso tiene una pequeña despensa.
Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar, para que ellos no tengan que pasar por ninguna privación como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer más ropas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues le será muy provechosa.
texts.en: Señora Antonia is 30-years-old and is a single mother of 3 school-aged children for whom she always fights.  She is very enterprising and hard-working.  She makes and sells clothing and other products made out of yarn that she herself makes with her machine.  She also has a small grocery store.  Thanks to her work and effort, she can provide her children with everything they need and also keep them in school, so they don't have to suffer any hardship like she had to.  She is requesting this loan to buy yarn and dye to weave more clothing because she has a lot of requests from her customers this season.  She is thankful for the help she is receiving.  It will be very beneficial to her.

loans.use: To buy yarn and dye to be able to weave.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gaudencia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Gaudencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Citas

texts.en:
Citas is 57 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Citas runs a beauty-products retail business in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan of PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell.

Citas has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, lotion, perfume, etc. 

In the future, Citas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beauty products to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 38 years old, married and has seven children. He is from Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. Julie owns and operates a nipa-making business (weaving nipa palm to make roofing materials).  He has been in his business for 4 years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité de  Mujeres Kuña Katupyry  cuenta con16 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por  más pequeña que sea. las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza.
Deysi es una mujer que se desvive por su familia, ellos son quienes la inspiran a seguir luchando para poder alcanzar sus metas. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y nos cuenta que este ha sido su medio de trabajo hace ya un tiempo. Gracias a esto ayuda en la casa y a su familia y desea poder seguir mucho tiempo mas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en prendas, las cuales quiere vender y asi seguir trabajando. Su meta es tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes
texts.en:
The women's group Kuña Katupyry has 16 members; each has a small business to which she is dedicated, no matter how small.  The ladies feel very excited.  The mutual help between them is constant and above all, they inspire each other to continue fighting for their families, using all the available resources; this makes their resolve their greatest strength.  

Deysi is a woman who is devoted to her family; they are the ones who inspire her to continue fighting to be able to reach her goals.  She works selling all types of clothing and tells us that this has been her job for quite awhile.  Thanks to this help in the home and her family, she desires to be able to continue for much longer.  Her goal is to have a store where she could offer her products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es casado, tiene una hija y vive en la ciudad de Luque. El nos cuenta que tiene una empresa serigrafía ya hace más de 20 años. Dicha empresa se especializa para la pintura de las telas para los atuendos deportivos de los clubes de la Liga Paraguaya de futbol.
En su negocio lo ayuda su esposa y su hija en el aérea de administración. El comenta que toda su familia esta unida en el trabajo, lo que lo motiva más para seguir adelante y luchar por ellos día a día.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de pinturas y laminas de cartones para impresiones de camisetas, los cuales son los elementos que el utiliza para poder trabajar. Comenta que le dará un mejor margen de ganancia y asi tener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonio is married, has one daughter, and lives in the city of Luque. He tells us that he has had a silk screen printing business for more than 20 years. Said business specializes in printing the cloth for athletic uniforms used by clubs in the Paraguayan Soccer Association. 

In his business he's assisted by his wife and daughter in the administration area. He says that all of his family is united in the work, which is what motivates him even more to get ahead and work for them every day. 

He is requesting a loan to buy paint and sheets of cardboard for printing t-shirts, which are elements of his work. He says that it will give him a better profit margin, so he will have a little better income.

loans.use: to buy paint and sheets of cardboard for printing t-shirts.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is married, 57 years of age, and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur with her 10 children. Matilde is operating a home products buy-and-sell business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and she earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products such as lotion, lipsticks and many others. 

Matilde's business is very stable in her community. She joined GDMPC last year. In the future, Matilde will use her income to support her children in their studies until they finish college and also to support their daily needs. Matilde wishes that her business will become more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as lotion, lipsticks and many others

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La  Sra. Lida es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Andres de  38 años de edad. Juntos tienen 1 Hijo, aun pequeño.
La Sra. Lida tiene una Despensa en su casa, y nos comenta que está bien surtida, y es por eso que tiene muy buena clientela. Es una señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente con fundación paraguaya y con otras entidades financieras. Comenta que su meta es seguir creciendo y de esa forma ayudar a su marido con la manutención de la casa para poder darle un buen futuro a su hijo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, productos a granel y demás. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de fundación paraguaya y de kiva.
texts.en:
Lida is from the city of Santaní. She is 30 years old, and married to Andres, 38. They have a small son.

Lida has a small grocery store in her home which she says is well stocked, and that is why she has a very good customer base. She is a very hardworking lady, and is an excellent client of Fundación Paraguaya and other financial institutions. She says her goal is to continue growing her business and thus help her husband with maintenance of their house and to give a good future for their child.

Lida is requesting a loan to buy groceries, beverages, vegetables, and other wholesale products. She is thankful for the help she is receiving from Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Marilin Jimena

texts.es: La Sra. Marilin Tiene 35 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con 2 hijos que son de 4, 2, 3 y 9 años,  Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza por catalogo,  Este préstamo es la cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Marilin utilizara este préstamo para la compra de  cosméticos por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción por esta  razón solicita este préstamo para  aumento de capital y mejorar sus ingresos económicos,  Marilin  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para la compra de algunos artefactos para su casa, la Sra. Marilin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marilin is 35 years old and is a single mother of 4 children who are 4, 2, 3 and 9 years old.  She earns a living selling cosmetics and beauty products from a catalog.  This loan is the fourth she will be requesting through this institution, and Marilin will use the loan in order to purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices and those that are on sale.  She is asking for this loan in order to increase her capital and to improver her economic earnings.  Marilin faces challenges in her business, such as competition, and she will use the profit she receives to purchase some things for her home.  Marilin is a very hard-working person and she is happy and thankful to this institution for the support that it offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics.

loans.name: Milciades Ferreira

texts.es:
El señor Milciades Pereira es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 32 años, está acompañado con la señora Mirian, tienen dos hijas pequeñas quienes aun van a la escuela.
El sr Milciades tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, pero también aparte de eso tiene otro trabajo en una empresa donde es chofer hace más de 5 años. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
 Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, fideos, arroz, etc., con lo cual podrá abastecer su local. El señor está muy agradecido con la fundación por que gracias a  eso agrando un poco mas su negocio, y fue mejorando la forma de vida  de  él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Milciades Pereira, 32, is from the city of Concepcion. He has a partner, Miram, and they have two young daughters who attend school.

Milciades has a well-stocked grocery store at home, but beyond that he also has another job as a driver for a company, which he has done for over 5 years. He is a hard worker, and above all he is eager to succeed and help his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy meat, drinks, noodles, rice, etc, to supply his store. Milciades is very grateful to the foundation, and it is thanks to them that he has been able to grow his business a little, and has been improving the lifestyle for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store.

loans.name: Victoria Ruth

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria tiene 68 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  35 y 27 años,  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, visitando casas y domicilios, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Victoria utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de diferentes modelos de ropa para vender, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumento de inventario,  Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia de las ventas de las mañaneras, Ella utilizara los beneficios llegando de a poco  tener una tienda propia y con el tiempo  sueña en administrar su propia tienda, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Victoria is 68 years old and married with two children (ages 35 and 27). She works as a mobile vendor by visiting houses and residences selling clothing. 

This loan will be her first with the institution; she will use the loan to buy different styles of clothing to sell. The reason for requesting the loan is to increase her inventory. 

Victoria faces challenges in her business - one being competition from early morning street vendors. She will use the gradually accumulating benefits to have her own store and she hopes that with time she will run her own store. She feels very appreciative to the institution for the support they've offered.

loans.use: to buy different styles of clothing.

loans.name: Tolentina

texts.en:
Tolentina is married with 6 children. Tolentina is 50 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Tolentina sells charcoal to earn a living.  She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase coconut shell for her coco-charcoal business.

Tolentina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Tolentina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shell for her coco-charcoal business

loans.name: Emlyn

texts.en: Emlyn is a married woman with six children. Emlyn is 45 years old and she resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte in the Philippines. Emlyn owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Emlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Emlyn hopes to support her children in completing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lucena Angao

texts.en:
Lucena is 43 years old and lives in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child.
 
Lucena has a sari-sari (variety) store business and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for additional groceries and consumable goods for her business. 

Lucena has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Lucena hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To pay for additional groceries and consumable goods.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 44 años está al frente de una zapatería que es propia. El señor vive en casa de sus padres que ya son de edad muy avanzada y el los cuida.
Oscar nos cuenta que para él la vida fue muy difícil ya que tiene un impedimento físico en sus piernas lo cual le dificulta bastante caminar y desenvolverse normalmente, cuando niño le ayudaba a su padre en la zapatería y  a poco fue aprendiendo a hacer los zapatos ya que era un trabajo que no requeria de muchos movimientos de las piernas, más bien se pasaba más tiempo sentado trabajando, fue por eso que se especializo en fabricación y compostura de zapatos y hasta ahora tiene muchos clientes, y es un negocio bastante bueno y rentable.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando, ya sea haciendo zapatos o componiéndolos. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando de salir adelante y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
44-year-old Oscar is from the city of Concepción, and manages his own shoe store. He lives with his parents, who are very old and he looks after them.
Oscar tells us that life for him has been very difficult because he has a physical disability in his legs, which makes it hard to walk and function normally. 

As a child helped his father in the shoe store and soon learned to make shoes. As the job did not require much leg movement he could spend more time sitting at work which is why he specialized in the manufacture and repair of shoes. Oscar now has many clients, and it is a good and profitable business.

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of leather, which will enable him to continue working, either making or repairing shoes. He is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity he is being given to succeed and continue working.

loans.use: to buy leather for his workshop.

loans.name: Clemente Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente tiene 50 años y es casado tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de  11 y 17 años, se dedica a la  Tapicería su taller se  encuentran en la zona 21 de enero, esta es la primera secuencia de su crédito dentro de la institución, el Sr. Clemente utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de materiales para la  fabricación de un  juego de living  ya que tiene un pedido que entregar,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, el Sr. Clemente enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el mercado y utilizara los beneficios para seguir creciendo en su actividad, el deseo del  Sr. Clemente es comprar una camioneta para poder transportar sus productos, se siente muy feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Clemente is 50 years old. He is married with two children who are 11 and 17 years old. He has an upholstery business. His workshop is located in zone 21 of Enero. This is the first loan sequence that he has taken out through the institution. Clemente will use the loan to buy materials to make a living room set which has already been ordered by a customer. The reason he has decided to take out a loan is to increase his working capital. The challenges he faces in his business are competition in the market and using the profits to continue growing his business. Clemente wants to be able to buy a truck to use to transport his products. He is very happy and thankful for the support that the institution has provided.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a living room set.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is married with 3 children. Leo is 56 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Leo is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 5 years. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for his rice field and to purchase an additional parcel of rice land. 

Leo has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Leo hopes to purchase additional parcel of rice land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice field and to purchase an additional parcel of rice land

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a married woman with four children aged 7, 10, 15 and 17. She lives in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Ernestina sells buko (coconut) salad and ice candy to her community. Ernestina's husband is a farmer. She also helps her husband maintain their rice farm and sell their produce at the market.

Ernestina is a hardworking woman. She said she only wants the best for her family. She applied for a loan to buy ingredients such as buko (coconut), fruit cocktail, milk and sugar. Ernestina hopes to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as buko (coconut), fruit cocktail, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 11 children. 

Elizabeth is engaged in a fish-vending business and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing nets. 

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save more for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: La Main De Dieu Group

texts.fr: LA MAIN DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Philomène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un Dessinateur du nom de Eustache. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Philomène  vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de douze ans, Philomène vend des conserves, des céréales et des condiments dans une région du Benin. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Philomène et les autres membres du groupe LA MAIN DE DIEU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
LA MAIN DE DIEU is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood.

The group's representative, Philomène (raising her hand in the photo), is 41 years old and married to a graphic artist named Eustache.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Philomène lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.

Philomène has been selling canned food, grains and condiments in one of the regions of Benin, for almost twelve years.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

It is the third time that Philomène and the other members of the group LA MAIN DE DIEU are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' needs.  Their previous two loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food, grains and condiments.

loans.name: Iracema

texts.es: La Señora Iracema tiene 36 años de edad nacida en la ciudad de Beni, ella vive en su domicilio propio en la zona de Bibosi, trabaja con EMPRENDER desde el 2009, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace dos años, vende comida por su zona donde tiene muchos clientes ya que la Sra. Iracema cocina riquísimos platillos, además que atiende con amabilidad a sus clientes, el crédito tiene como destino compra de un puesto de venta  en el mercado, la Sra. Iracema es una persona trabajadora su deseo es poder tener un restaurante y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Iracema, 36, was born in the town of Beni, and now lives in her own home in the Bibosi area. She has been working with EMPRENDER since 2009, and for two years she has had a business selling food. Iracema sells food in her neighborhood and has many customers as she cooks delicious dishes, in addition to her kind service.

With this loan, Iracema intends to purchase a stall in the market. She is a hard worker and her desire is to have a restaurant so she can better serve her customers, and she is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase a stall in the market

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La Sra. María  tiene 63 años la Sra. es viuda ya que su esposo fallecio hace mucho,  Ella se dedica a la atención de su bazar - librería que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio en la zona de Pampahasi,  Este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución,  María utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de dos vitrinas para exponer sus  regalos,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital. María enfrenta retos en su negocio que son baja de ventas en las vacaciones escolares. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios en mejorar su tienda, el deseo de la Sra. María es con el tiempo realizar la remodelación de su casa, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única actividad con la que se mantiene.
texts.en:
63-year-old María is a widow since her husband died long ago. She looks after his business, a gift store that is located in her home in the Pampahasi area. 

This loan is her third cycle with the institution, and María will invest it in the purchase of two glass cases to display their gifts. Her reason for seeking this loan is to increase her working capital. María's challenge with her business is that sales are low during the school holidays. She will use the profits to improve her store, and María's desire is to renovate her house over time. She feels very grateful to the institution for their support, as this is the only activity she has.

loans.use: to purchase two display cases to display her gifts, and also to purchase more gifts.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel tiene 57 años no es casada pero convive con su pareja hace ya varios años, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes  en su tienda que se encuentran en la zona Jardín del sur. Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Isabel utilizara este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción  del  techo de su tienda, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar su tienda,  la Sra. Isabel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, y  utilizara los beneficios en comprarse cosas para su casa como electrodomésticos, su deseo es crecer en su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isabel is 57 years old. She is not married but lives with her partner whom she has been with for many years. She makes a living selling groceries from her store that is located in the zone 'Jardín del sur'. This is her first loan sequence that she has taken out through the institution. Isabl will use this loan to buy construction material to put a roof on her store. The reason for requesting this loan is so that she can improve her store. The challenge she faces with her business is keeping her stock up with customer demand. She uses the profits of her business to buy herself things for the house, like household appliances. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a roof for her store.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza is from Lower Tiparak in Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old. Niza is married and has five children. To make a living, Niza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Niza has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Niza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niza is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana has been a farmer for 20 years. She is 46 years old and married with three children, ages 4, 17 and 21. Juana primarily grows rice crops to sell. She owns the land that she tills to plant rice crops. 

Juana requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. This will help Juana achieve a better yield. Juana hopes to earn better and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 47 years old and married with four children, ages 21, 22, 24 and 26. Prisca's husband works as a barangay (neighborhood) captain.

Prisca makes snacks such as banana cue, pancakes, camote cue and rice cakes to sell to her community. She is able to help buy her family's daily needs with her income from food vending. One of Prisca's goals is to have all her children finish college and find jobs.

Prisca asked for a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil, banana, camote, flour and milk. Prisca hopes to have a better income in order for her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, cooking oil, bananas, camote, flour and milk.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a married woman who has a child. Linda is 58 years old and resides at Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboang del Sur, Philippines. 

Linda owns farmland and plants and harvests rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2009, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Linda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 57 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela. Caridad is widowed with four children. 

Caridad has a general store that sells a variety of products. Caridad has had this business for 30 years. She earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month from this activity. Caridad requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Caridad has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Caridad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela. Editha is married with four children. 

Editha has a store that sells a variety of products. Editha has had this business for 23 years. Editha requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 48 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Wilma is married with 5 children. 
Wilma has a general store that sells a variety of products. Wilma has had this business for 9 years. Wilma requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. 
Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, Wilma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: Reginalda

texts.en:
Reginalda is a 39-year-old married woman with six school-aged children. Her husband works as a farmer and Barangay (neighborhood) councilor.

Reginalda started farming 10 years ago. She works with her husband in cultivating their land and planting rice crops. They also hire some laborers to help during land preparation. Reginalda requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Reginalda hopes for their farming business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 57 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban. She is married with 9 children. 
Erlinda has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 15 years. Erlinda requested a loan of PHP11,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 44 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Delia is married with 3 children. 
To earn a living, Delia has a business selling banana cue (popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. Delia earns about PHP 1,150 each month doing this type of work. Delia has requested a loan of PHP10,000 to purchase additional ingredients for banana cue making.
Delia has been a member of PMPC for 5 months. In the future, Delia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for banana cue making

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric, 40. He is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Medeline, a housewife and mother to their three children. By the grace of God, Eric has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eric operates a tricycle transportation business. He has one tricycle that carries up to five passengers to their destination within the community. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his tricycle and also to buy spare parts. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Eric dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. He also dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 50, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ordialyn, a jeepney driver, and a mother to their two children. By the grace of God, Avelina has managed to support her child's schooling. Her two children have already settled down with their own families. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Avelina oversees operations of their jeepney* transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and spare parts of their jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Avelina hopes to have another vehicle some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*Curiously, Jeepney has purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw out the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepney is one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

**All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 50 years old and lives in San Jose, Sinacaban. She is married with 4 children. 
Melissa has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 10 years. Melissa requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Melissa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Melissa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Mor est un jeune agriculteur  qui a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Il est marié et père de famille. Il habite à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Il y possède un champ ou il fait du maraichage. Il sollicite son 3ème crédit  dans l’institution et cela pour acheter des semences de choux et des intrants agricoles (gasoil, engrais) .Mor démarre  sa journée à 8 h pour la terminer à 18h. Il gère la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Et avec les revenus de son activité il peut  améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille et réussi même à épargner. Car il voudrait ouvrir une boutique de produits agricoles dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Mor is a young farmer with more than 10 years experience in this domain. He is married and a father. He lives approximately 22 km from the main town. He owns a field where he practices market gardening. He is requesting his third loan with the institution and this to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs (diesel oil, fertilizer). Mor starts his day at 8am and finishes at 6pm. He manages his family's daily expenses. And with the income from his business he can improve the nutritional conditions of the family and even manages to save. Because he would like to open a store selling agricultural products in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs (diesel oil, fertilizer).

loans.name: Jaquelin  Karina

texts.es:
Jaqueline vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza porque es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, así como también porque sus pobladores son muy conocidos por la buena sazón que tienen para la preparación de platillos. Jaqueline convive junto a su pareja el cual trabaja como profesor y sus dos hijos  cuyas edades comprenden doce y diez años a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su alegría y su razón de vivir y por los cuales da la vida y se esfuerza por salir adelante cada día.

Con mucho esfuerzo Jaqueline inicio su negocio de preparación y venta de dulces como tortas, alfajores, panes, gelatinas, entre otros; ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas,  ella tiene una buena sazón para los dulces y por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, además de atender con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes ya que la mayoría son niños y siempre les tiene paciencia.

Jaqueline está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su horno, comprar un horno mas y comprar utensilios de repostería, lo que le permitirá poder elaborar más dulces de manera más  rápida y tener mejores utensilios para realizar mejor su trabajo, así ella seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su empresa de repostería y panadería y preparar los mejores dulces de su ciudad y sobre todo darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Jaqueline lives in the city of Chincha, which is known as the cradle of Peruvian athletes. The people there are also very well known for their tasty food. Jaqueline lives with her husband, a teacher, and their two children, ages 10 and 12, whom she loves very much. They are her source of happiness and her reason to live, and it's because of them that she works hard every day to get ahead.

With a lot of hard work Jaqueline started a business making and selling sweets like cakes, alfajores, breads, puddings and other things. She works about 8 hours a day at her business. She has a good taste for sweets and she thinks that's why her business is going well, along with her friendly customer service. Most of her customers are children and she's always patient with them.

Jaqueline is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to do maintenance on her oven, buy another oven, and buy other implements for baking that will allow her to make more treats more quickly and have better equipment to do her work. She will keep working in order to achieve her dream - "having a pastry and bakery business and making the best sweets in the city, and above all giving her children an occupation."

loans.use: to buy equipment for a bakery.

loans.name: Marcos Humberto

texts.es:
Marcos vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, a los cuales ama mucho en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, hermosas playas , así como también por su agricultura en especial del cultivo de arroz, así mismo se le conoce por se una ciudad donde se cocinan los ricos camarones.  Marcos en su tiempo libre le gusta ir a pescar, ya que lo relaja mucho y lo distrae de las preocupaciones; como buen peruano le gusta la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Pollo a la Braza”; Marcos solo tuvo estudios primarios, por ello trabaja mucho para hacer que sus hijos sean mejores que el y tengan un buen porvenir.

Con mucho esfuerzo el trabaja como maestro constructor, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias, dependiendo del tamaño y tipo de construcción que realice, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y los acabados en sus construcciones son muy buenos y bonitos, por ello sus clientes siempre lo recomiendan.

Marcos está muy agradecido y feliz por la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios kiva, ya que con su apoyo el podrá comprar madera y herramientas( comba, martillos, espatulas para tarrajeo entre otros) para poder realizar su trabajo de construcción, especialmente cuando realice el techado de las casas; lo que le permitirá tener los implementos necesarios para la realización de su trabajo, así seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his wife and two children, who he loves very much. They live in the city of Camana which is known for it's hot climate, beautiful beaches, cultivation of rice and for being a place that you can get deliciously prepared shrimp. In his free time Marcos likes to go fishing because it is relaxing and helps him forget about his problems. Like a good Peruvian, he likes traditional food; his favorite dish is 'Pollo a la Braza' (roasted chicken). Marcos only studied in primary school, which is why he works so hard so that his children will be better than him and have a better future.  

He puts great effort into his work as a master builder. He works close to 12 hours a day, depending on the size and type of construction that he is doing. He believes his business is doing well because he does good work and because his finished products are of good quality and look good, and for these reasons his customers recommend him to others. 

Marcos is very thankful and happy for the help that has been provided by Kiva lenders. Thanks to your support he will be able to buy wood and tools (ropes, hammers, spatulas for plastering walls, as well as other things) that will allow him to do his construction work, especially when constructing roofs for houses. This will allow him to have the tools that are necessary to do his work, and in this way continue to work so that he can realize his greatest dream of helping his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus abuelos a los que quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposa y su hijo de dos añitos, viven en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, así como también por su agricultura. Jose es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, el trabaja como chofer  de mototaxi desde hace dos años, ya que tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse una moto y con ello decidió trabajar en este rubro, su esposa lo apoya en todo lo que el hace y asimismo ella trabaja en el campo y entre ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar. Jose cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque se esfuerza mucho por hacer bien su trabajo.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá iniciar su negocio de librería, el comprar útiles como cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas bond, entre otros útiles para formar su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, además poder seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y tener una cadena de librerías”.
texts.en:
Jose, 28, lives with his wife and son of only two years together in the house of his grandparents whom he loves very much. They live in the city of Imperial, which is characterized by the friendliness of its inhabitants and by its agriculture. Jose is an enthusiastic and hard working young man. He has worked as a motor rickshaw driver for two years. He had the opportunity to purchase one, so he decided to go into this line of work. His wife supports him in everything he does. She also works in the fields. The two of them together contribute to the household expenses. Jose believes that everything is going well with his business because he is very friendly with his customers and because he makes a big effort to do his job well. 

Jose is grateful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to start his bookstore. He is going to purchase supplies such as notebooks, pens, and sheets of paper, among other things he will need to start the business. The business would allow him to earn more income and improve his quality of life. It would also allow him to continue fighting to accomplish his biggest goals of giving his son a profession and opening a chain of bookstores.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as notebooks, pens, paper, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kazungu, and he is a businessman which he contributes to the family basic needs. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Food is the family’s highest monthly expense. 

Margaret sells charcoal at wholesale prices. She has done so for five years and her primary customers are restaurant operators. Margaret's other source of income comes from farming. The high cost of transportation is her greatest business challenge. 

Margaret will use a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to enlarge her selling stall and purchase more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to become a major supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to enlarge her selling stall and purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Santa Marianita  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Marianita está formado por 11 socias y 1 socio. La señora Ana es parte de este Banco Comunal que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio, su marido es comerciante.
 
Ella nos cuenta que los  miembros de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Para ellos este es su primer ciclo y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo mas ya que se han dado cuenta de la oportunidad que les brinda la institución para poder acceder  a un crédito rápido y con intereses muy bajos.

Doña Ana es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito, para que él lo utilice es su negocio pues él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado de la ciudad en el cual improvisa un pequeño puesto los cuatro días que vende sus productos, en estos días él madruga al mercado de mayoristas para comprar sus productos los mismos que luego vende al menudeo a las distintas personas que acuden al lugar.  Lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad y es como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para vender a sus clientes.
 	
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.

La foto pequeña es de una de las socias que por motivos del trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó ls foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Santa Marianita' is made up of 11 women and 1 man. Ana is a member of this communal bank. They have meetings every two weeks in the parish Pacoaza, which is in the city of Portoviejo. Ana is 30 years old, she is married by civil union, from which she has two children who are 12 and 3 years old. The oldest child studies in junior high. Her husband is a salesman. 
 
She told us that the members of this group are involved in different businesses involving general commerce and offering services. This is the first loan cycle for the group. They hope to continue working together for a long time, because they recognize the opportunity that is offered through the institution to be able to access loans very quickly and with very low interest rates. 

Ana is a very good mother and housewife. She is taking the loan out to be able to help her husband. He will use it for his business, in which he sells fruits and vegetables. He sells in the city market from a small stall, four days a week. On these days he wakes up very early to go to the wholesale market where he buys his products, which he then resells to the people that come to him in the market. He has been doing this for over 15 years, which has allowed him to help his family get ahead. 

This loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables to sell to his customers. 

Their dreams are to give the very best to their children and to have a small grocery store in their home.  
 	
The small picture is of one of the members who was not able to be there, for other work commitments. the day the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo estrallitas esta integrado por 9 personas muy trabajadoras y alegres la cuales tienen una actividad economica la cual desarollan para ganar un poco de dinero extra y asi poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida,este grupo se encuentra hubicado en una zona Cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio la margarita y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña, sus integrantes son: Zacarias venta de abarrotes, epifania venta de refrescos, ines venta de antojitos, ismael venta de dulces, Guadalupe venta de refrescos, Esmeralda venta de ropa, Hilaria venta de ropa, Yolanda venta de antojitos y Vriginia venta de ropa. 

La señora Epifania es uno de los miembros del grupo ella tiene la edad de 59 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y es viuda, ella actualmente vive sola ya que sus hijos ya estan casados, doña epifania nos platica que desde muy pequeña le enseñaron sus padres a trabajar y gracias a esto a saco adelante a su familia, ella actualmente tiene un pequeño deposito de refrescos en su casa con la intencion de ganar un poco de dinero, ella realiza sus ventas con sus amigos y vecinos, ella comenta que como ya tiene muchos años vendiondo ya es conocida en su barrio y Gracias a Dios se vende bien, ella en su negocio siempre tiene musica ya que piensa que eso atrae a sus clientes, doña epifania invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de refrescos para resurtir su nagocio. Doña epifania desea que su negocio continue creciendo y sus ventas aumenten ya que solo asi podra tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Este grupo agradece a la fundacion por la confianza y el apoyo que les han brindado.
texts.en:
The group Estrellitas (little stars) consists of nine people who are very hardworking and happy. They have been developing their businesses in order to earn a little extra money and be able to give their families a better quality of life. This group is located in the Cañera zone, 15 minutes from the La Margarita sugar refinery. The town's residents plant and cultivate sugar cane. The group's members are: Zacarias, who sells groceries; Epifania, who sells soft drinks; Ines who sells snacks; Ismael who sells sweets; Guadalupe who sells soft drinks; Esmeralda who sells clothing; Hilaria who sells clothing; Yolanda, who sells snacks and Virginia who sells clothing.

Epifania is one of the group members and is 59 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school and she is a widow. She currently lives alone because her children are already married. Miss Epifania tells us that since she was little, her parents taught her to work and thanks to this, she has gotten ahead in life with her family. She currently has a small soft drink store in her house and earns some money from it. She sells to her friends and neighbors. She says that now that she has been selling her products for many years and is well known in her neighborhood, thanks to God, she sells a lot. She always has music playing in her business and she believes that this attracts her customers. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a variety of soft drinks to revive her business. She wants to continue growing her business and increasing sales so that she can have a better quality of life. 

This group really appreciates the trust and support that the foundation has given them.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a 53-year-old woman. She has four children and three are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Bezani and he does farming. Mlongo operates a business of raising goat for meat sale at the market. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are residents. Mlongo's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mlongo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy goats to raise for meat sale for her business. Mlongo aspires to expand her business of selling at a wholesale in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more goats to raise for meat sale for her business.

loans.name: Cherry Fe Joy

texts.en:
Cherry Fe Joy is 24 years old and lives in San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban. Cherry Fe Joy is married with one child.
 
Cherry Fe Joy has a store that sells a variety of products. Cherry Fe Joy has had this business for two years. Cherry Fe Joy requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Cherry Fe Joy has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Cherry Fe Joy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita is 62 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

Ma. Lolita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more fish to sell.

Ma. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ma. Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
This is Luzvilla, 50. She is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a driver, and is mother to their children. By the grace of God, Luzvilla has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Luzvilla oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community; the tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luzvilla dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Victor is a married man with a 23-year-old child. He makes "bahalina" (coconut wine) for a living. Victor also makes vinegar to sell to his community. Victor has a coconut farm, which is the source of his coconut wine and vinegar.

Victor is asking for a loan to invest in his business. He plans to purchase food coloring and containers. This loan will help increase Victor's business profitability. Victor is continuously working hard to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase food coloring and containers.

loans.name: Fifagbe Group

texts.fr: FIFAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de six ans, Madeleine vend des chaussures et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante au Benin. Madeleine  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la cinquième fois que Madeleine et les autres membres du groupe FIFAGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFAGBE is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  

The representative of the group, Madeleine (raising her hand in the photo), is 33 years old and married to a man named Marc.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Madeleine attended school for a very short period of time only.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses along with her husband.

Madeleine has been selling shoes and kitchen utensils, door-to-door, in Benin, for almost six years.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

It is the fifth time that Madeleine and the other members of the FIFAGBE group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' needs.  Their previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and shoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with four children. Joseph is 45 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Joseph owns a general store to earn a living; this is his new business. He has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock for his grocery store. Joseph has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
This is Ismael, 39. He is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Ofelia, a businesswoman, and is the father to their children. By the grace of God, Ismael has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ismael oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Ismael himself drives their tricycle. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Ismael dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. He also dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micrfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Gbetoenomon Group

texts.fr: GBETOENOMON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Akouavi Sylvie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom Ferdinand. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Sylvie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de treize ans, Akouavi Sylvie vend du riz, de haricot et des condiments dans son quartier. Akouavi Sylvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Akouavi Sylvie et les autres membres du groupe GBETOENOMON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBETOENOMON is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood.

The representative of the group, Akouavi Sylvie (raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old and married to a mechanic named Ferdinand.  The couple has two children, both in school and their dependents.  Akouavi Sylvie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses along with her husband.

She has been selling rice, beans and condiments in her own neighborhood for close to thirteen years. She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

It is the third time that Akouavi Sylvie and the other members of the GBETOENOMON group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' needs. Their two previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and beans.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married. Rufina is 58 years old and lives in Gil, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rufina sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase feed and piglets.

Rufina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte
