Evelyn es una joven de 24 años de edad, convive junto a  su pareja , el cual se dedica a su trabajo como obrero en un fundo y sus dos hijos cuyas edades comprenden 1 y 4 años; vive junto a ellos en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido en cualquier época del año, por el cultivo de algodón , uva , espárragos, alcachofas, asimismo por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos mas importantes del país como lo es “la laguna de Huacachina”. En su tiempo libre a Evelyn le gusta compartir con sus hijos y sobre todo degustar de uno de sus platillos preferidos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres Evelyn solo tuvo educación primaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Educación.

Evelyn se dedica a su negocio de bodega en la cual vende abarrotes, frutas, verduras, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad.

Evelyn está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora con tres andamios y compra de bebidas para su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener más productos para ofrecer y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá trabajando día a día para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Construir su casa de material Noble”.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a 24-year old woman. She lives with her partner, who is a farm worker, and her two children, who are 1 and 4 years old. She lives with them in Ica, a city known for its hot climate throughout the year; for the cultivation of cotton, grapes, asparagus, and artichokes; and for having one of the country's most important tourist attraction, Lake Huacachina. Evelyn likes to spend her free time with her children and, most of all, to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious "chicken with rice." Given her parent's limited resources, Evelyn only attended primary school, but she would have liked to study education.

Evelyn works in her bodega, where she sells groceries, fruits, and vegetables, among other items. She works about 8 hours, and she believes her business does well because she offers quality products. 

Evelyn is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as with the support they have offered, she will be able to buy a freezer with three shelves and beverages for her business. This will allow her to offer more products and be able to increase her income. She then will continue working day to day to achieve her great dream: "To build a high quality home."

loans.use: to buy a freezer and shelves.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is aged 35 and has earned a living as a farmer for the last 10 years. Her farm currently produces bananas, maize, beans and milk for the local market, and the money she earns allows her to meet her family's needs. She is married and has three children who range in age from 4 to 16 years old. She is requesting a loan for KES 60,000, which she intends to use in a constructing a grazing area for her dairy cows. She will also increase the number of her cows to five within five years. She believes the resulting increase in income will make life better for her family. Her main challenge is insufficient rain, which makes feeding her cattle costly and difficult.

loans.use: to build a grazing area for her cows.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 59 years old, widowed and has six children. She is in the livestock-raising business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to  raise and sell. She has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Remedios would like to save money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 52 years old, married and has 6 children 2 of whom are in school.

Lucita is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucita has been hog raising for 7 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widowed mother of five children. She is 53 years old.She knits sweaters and has been in the business for the past eleven years.

This is Ruth's first term loan from KADET LTD.She was brought to KADET LTD, by a staff member. She will use the loan amount to purchase an over lock machine and knitting yarns for use in her business.

She hopes to expand her business and create employment for others.

loans.use: to purchase an over lock machine and knitting yarns for use in her business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda, 42, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Valeriano, an employee, They have two children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Imelda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Imelda is requesting a Php18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Imelda hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: This time Rosita is borrowing Php 16,000 to fund her hog raising business. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Rosita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en: Felicita is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. She describes herself as an innovative woman. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are town people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Felicita's dream and business goal is to run an exhibition selling clothes mall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
This is Consorcia, 54, who lives in Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and the mother of six children. She and her children manage their own household while operating a business where she buys candy and toys from wholesalers, then repacks them for sale at a small profit. Her customers are attracted by the low prices and many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to expand her product inventory by buying more candies and toys. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Consorcia hopes to grow her business, and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Bible, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy candies and toys to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 55, has a retail shop from which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She and her husband have 10 children.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her shop.

In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the Philippines. Ruth has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

Ruth is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia, age 43, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also prepares and sells viands and fruits. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to offer for sale in her retail store as well as to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages to offer for sale in her retail store as well as to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.en:
Juan Pablo has a passion for protecting the environment and a love for cars. After his career on the Olympic Karate Team of Honduras ended with a serious injury, Juan Pablo turned his attention to these passions. 

He worked to develop his own concept for a green, waterless carwash. In 2009, he moved to Miami, Florida from Honduras to promote his product and further develop his business. When developing this solution, he focused his attention on creating an all-purpose wash that could be used for all vehicles and had the environment in mind. The solution that he developed was a dirt and oil remover that did not include the harmful ingredients found in most chemical detergents, and that could be used in the absence of water. 

Juan Pablo now would like to get his product to the mass market with smart advertising. He would like to see his product used across the United States, and would like this loan to market his product outside of his South Florida community.

loans.use: To invest in a media and radio marketing campaign

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 48 years old, married, and has two children. He describes himself as a creative man. He operates a butcher shop, which he has been doing for four years.  He employs one staff member. His business is located at an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Noel is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy more meat.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. His business goal is to run another butcher shop within five years.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel, age 36, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells personal accessories and school supplies. She has had this business for six years. She is widowed and has three children.

Russel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 to buy stocks of personal accessories and school supplies to offer for sale.

In the future, Russel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy personal accessories and school supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie, age 31, operates a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He is unmarried and is the father of one child.

Ronnie has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. He has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.  

In the future, Ronnie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga, age 72, owns and operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She and her husband have eight children.

Domingga has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. She has requested a loan in the amount of 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
 
In the future, Domingga hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 64, runs a variety store to earn an income. She has been in this business for five years and sells items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent, and snack foods. She and her husband have six children and she works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Virginia has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Virginia requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making business.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her furniture making

loans.name: Ignacio Suarez Suyon

texts.es: Ignacio es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad. Él vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural llamada Morropón en Piura. Esta familia goza de buenas referencias pues son muy unidos y trabajadores. Ignacio se dedica a la compra y venta de cervezas. Este negocio le ha traído buenas recompensas que le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Es por ello que desea seguir invirtiendo en él y ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de cerveza y en otro negocio de compra de maíz en grano que luego comercializa. Ignacio recibe el apoyo de su esposa en las actividades que realiza, las cuales son el sustento del hogar, es por ello que este crédito le sería de mucha ayuda a su familia. Ignacio es un cliente recurrente de nuestra institución y goza de buenas referencias crediticias por su puntualidad a la hora de cancelar los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ignacio is a 54-year-old father.  He lives with his wife and two children in a rural community called Morropón, in Piura.  This family has good references because they are very close and hardworking.

Ignacio buys and sells beer.  This business has brought him good earnings that have helped him improve his quality of life.  That is why he wants to keep investing in it.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 3000 PEN that he will invest in buying beer and in another business, buying kernel corn that later he will sell.  Ignacio has the support of his wife in the activities he does, with which he supports the household.  That is why this loan would be a big help for his family.

Ignacio is a regular client of our institution and he has good credit references because of his punctuality when it comes to paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy beer and kernel corn to sell.

loans.name: Janny Marleny Ipanaque Zapata

texts.es:
Janny tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en casa propia, en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella ha decidido apoyar a su pareja, quien se dedica netamente a la agricultura, en el sostenimiento de su familia incursionando en la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza vía catálogo. Ella se esfuerza por mantener su actividad, siempre buscando nuevos clientes a los cuales ofrecerles sus productos.  Asimismo se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores en el mercado de su zona.

En los últimos meses su negocio está gozando de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, por lo que está pensando comprar mercadería (más productos de belleza) y ofrecerla a su clientela de modo que no tengan que esperar siempre por su producto hasta fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Janny es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa. Ella ha sabido ganarse a sus vecinos, los cuales la respetan y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Janny is 29 years old and lives with her partner.  She has three minor children and lives with her family in her own house in the district of Tambogrande, a district dedicated mainly to growing fruit, which is processed to be exported to other countries.  It is in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has decided to help her partner, who works in agriculture, in supporting the family by getting into selling cosmetics and beauty products via catalogue.  She makes an effort to support her work, always looking for new customers to whom to sell her products.  She also works buying and selling small animals in the market of her area.

In the past few months her business has enjoyed very good reception from her customers, so she is planning to buy merchandise to offer to her customers so they do not always have to wait for the product until the end of the month, which is when the order arrives.  To realize her goal she has seen the need to request for the first time a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, so they will help her achieve her goal.

Janny is a mother and a real fighter who very much likes to be active.  She has learned how to win over her neighbors, who respect and admire her a lot.

loans.use: to buy poultry and more beauty products.

loans.name: Mercy Veronica

texts.es:
Mercy tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera.  Habita en casa propia y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la comunidad, en el distrito de Olmos.  La comunidad es pequeña y los lugareños son muy amables y respetuosos.
Mercy se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace 2 años en la zona del Virrey a una hora de olmos.
Mercy desea invertir en su negocio, específicamente para el arreglo de corral y compra de alimentos, como maíz, para que de esa manera tenga mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor condición de vida en la zona.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
El mercado es  bueno para este tipo de negocio, ya que los pobladores en su mayoría se dedican a la crianza y venta de ganado menor.
El objetivo principal de Mercy es vender a un buen precio sus animales con la inversión en los alimentos y así tenga buenas utilidades, para ello se esfuerza al máximo para alcanzar su meta, pues trabaja más de 8 horas diarias.
texts.en:
Mercy is 30, has 3 children, and is a single mother.  She lives in her own home and has good personal and professional references in the community in the district of Olmos.  It is a small community, and the locals are friendly and respectful.

Mercy has raised and sold small animals for 2 years in the Virrey area, which is one hour from Olmos.  She hopes to invest in her business, specifically in fixing her corral and buying food like corn.  This will let her make a better income and therefore have better living conditions.  This is why she thought it was a good idea to obtain a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

The market is good for this type of business since the majority of people in the area raise and sell small livestock.  Mercy's goal is to sell her animals at a good price and to invest in their food.  This is why she is putting forth maximum effort to reach her goal.  She works more that 8 hours a day.

loans.use: to fix her corrals and buy nutritious food for her livestock.

loans.name: Susumi

texts.es: Susumi vive en uno de los barrios más tradicionales de la ciudad, justamente en el sur de ella, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos. Su potencial comercial es tradicional en su familia, pues su hermano tiene un restaurante en otro país mientras que su madre también vende mercancías, actividad que Susumi aprendió de ella, por eso tiene un restaurante donde vende almuerzos, que también aprovecha para ofrecer minutos a celulares. Ella inició en otro barrio, pero cuando tomó la suficiente experiencia, hace 3 años, se trasladó a un sector mucho más comercial ubicado sobre un boulevard donde se reúne diariamente  vecinos en las noches, hay varias empresas  y transita mucha gente. En la actualidad cuenta con 2 ayudantes para vender sus almuerzos y una en la venta de minutos a  celulares. Su negocio le ha ayudado a convertir los sueños de su hija en realidad, porque es toda una profesional y esto es gracias al trabajo de Susumi en su negocio y a la disciplina de estudio de su hija que hoy es una enfermera profesional y que actualmente se encuentra en otro país para seguir progresando y convertirse en médica. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará sillas, mesas, recargas y materias primas en mayor volumen y de contado para obtener descuentos y ofrecerle mayor confort a sus clientes.
texts.en: Susumi lives in one of the most traditional neighbourhoods in the south of the city. She lives with her husband and two children. Her line of work is in keeping with her family's traditions; her brother owns a restaurant in another country and her mother sells merchandise. Susumi learned salesmanship from her mother; now, she has a restaurant where she sells lunches and also sells cell phone minutes. She started off in another neighbourhood--but three years ago, when she had accumulated the necessary experience, she moved to a much more commercial area located on a boulevard where the neighbours meet every evening. There are various business located nearby, and the area is highly trafficked. Susumi currently has two helpers in her business. Her business has allowed her to make her childhood dreams reality; she is a professional, thanks to her hard work. Her daughter is a nurse, thanks to her hard work, and is currently living in another country studying to become a doctor. Susumi is currently applying for a Kiva loan, with which she will purchase a large quantity of chairs, tables, refills, and basic materials in cash in order to get a discount and offer better comfort to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of chairs, tables, refills and basic materials, in cash.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Gaviotas” se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 18 integrantes, de la ciudad de Asunción, todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas y están muy orgullosas de ello.
Maria vende jeans, y nos comenta que siempre tiene buena venta ya que siempre tiene muy variadas clases, por esto ya tiene muchas clientas y clientes que le hacen pedidos. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y a su habilidad para las ventas ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma obteniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jeans, con lo cual podrá seguir vendiendo y atrayendo a más clientes. Ella y su grupo están contentas por la ayuda que están recibiendo por parte de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
The “Las Gaviotas” ["The Gulls"] communal bank is in its fourth cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya's Female Entrepreneurs program. There are 18 members, all from the city of Asunción. They each have profitable businesses and are very proud of them.
Maria sells jeans. She tells us that she always has good sales because she always has a great variety of jeans and therefore many customers, some of whom make orders. Thanks to her hard work and her gift for making sales, she has been able to continue expanding her business and obtaining the means to help her family with their daily costs of living.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of jeans. With this purchase, she will be able to continue selling and attracting more customers. She and her group are happy to have this help from the Fundación and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy jeans for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and married with four children. Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from a local eatery.

Gina aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny, age 27, operates a general store business to earn an income. She has had this business for the past year. She also earns additional income from pearl vending. She and her husband have one child. Jenny works hard to help provide for her family. 

Jenny has repaid five previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Jenny aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena, age 35, runs a general store business where she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, sardines, soft drinks, sugar, and coffee. She has been in this business for two years. She and her husband have seven children. With six of her children enrolled in school, Morena works very hard to provide for them.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell in her store.

In the future, Morena would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Erlinda Cespedes Almeyda

texts.es:
Maria tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo se caracteriza por la generosidad de sus pobladores y su buena sazón para la preparación de los platillos típicos de la ciudad como lo son “la Carapulcra y la Sopa seca; pero el plato favorito de María es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”; Maria es madre de un pequeño de 11 años, al cual ama mucho y es su razón de vivir y por el cual ella trabaja muy duro para que el tenga una buena calidad de vida y sea mejor que ella.

Maria se dedica a la preparación y venta de cachina y vino, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella ofrece sus productos según los pedidos que tiene de otras ciudades del país, ella envía por vía terrestre dos veces al mes y durante el mes atiende alrededor de 10 clientes,, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y porque tiene una buena presentación.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar más insumos ( uva , botellas para envasar, etiquetas, entre otros), para la elaboración de sus productos, lo que le permitirá tener mas mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su mas grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material de concreto y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, a city known as the birthplace of the great glories of Peruvian sports as well as for the generosity of its inhabitants and its flavorful typical dishes such as “Carapulcar” and “Sopa seca”. Maria’s favorite dish is the delicious “Arroz Chaufa.” 

Maria is the mother of an 11 year old whom she dearly loves. He is her reason for living and working so hard. She wants to insure that he has a good quality of life and that it will be better than hers. 

Maria prepares “cachina” and other wines. She works around 8 hours a day and sells her product to other cities in the country on order, sending it by land transport twice a month. She fills orders from about 10 clients a month. She believes that her business is doing well because of the quality of her product and because her wines have a good presentation.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more supplies (grapes, bottles to fill, labels, among other items) in order to prepare her product, which will enable her to have more inventory to offer her customers.  Consequently she will be able to improve her income and continue fighting to fulfill her greatest dreams of building her house of concrete material and giving her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as grapes, bottles to fill and labels among other items.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 40-year-old married man and father of five children. Khalil has twenty years of experience in selling food and necessary goods. In 2008, he opened his grocery store and started to improve it gradually.

Khalil is a hardworking man. He does his best to provide his family with the best and healthiest living. Khalil is well known in his region and most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors who enjoy dealing with him. Khalil is planning to expand his business more and more in the future through opening another branch or starting wholesale trade.

Now he is applying for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with special goods requested by his customers.

He is sure that this loan will reflect positively on his social and financial situations.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with special goods requested by his customers

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 21 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Hanilet runs a pearl vending business in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. Hanilet has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Hanilet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Timmy

texts.en:
Timmy is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Timmy has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and firewood. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stock of bananas and firewood to sell.

Timmy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Timmy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of bananas and firewood to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 47, is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has an Internet cafe business, which she has run for eight years. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is enrolled in school.
 
Evelyn has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional computer set-ups for her Internet cafe.

In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional computer set-ups for her Internet cafe.

loans.name: Maria Evangeline

texts.en:
Maria Evangeline earns an income as a fish vendor. She works hard to support her family. She has operated her business for 10 years.

Maria Evangeline has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda, age 49, has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She and her husband have two children.

Medarda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

In the future, Medarda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Evengeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 48, runs a variety store business. She has operated this business for five years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and sells such items as snack foods and soap in her shop. She and her husband have six children, two of whom are enrolled in school.

Evangeline has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items such as snack foods and soap to sell in her store.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Maria Mildred

texts.en:
Maria Mildred, age 42, runs a variety store where she sells such items as shampoo, snack foods, and soft drinks. She has been in this business for three years. She and her husband have four children. With two of her children enrolled in school, Maria Mildred works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Mildred has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

In the future, Maria Mildred would like to save enough money to be able to afford to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 53, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She and her husband have five children.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale. 

In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. 

He has been operating an aluminum workshop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed three people. 

He started in the business with financial help from one of his relatives. Then he worked hard to save money until he was able to open his own aluminum workshop. 

Anwar describes his business environment as good because he is visited regularly by his customers. He has been able to improve his business. 

He has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy aluminum for his business. That will enable him to work well again. 

In the future, he hopes to have a big metal workshop so that his profit will allow him to improve his living conditions as well as to get married.

loans.use: to buy aluminum for his business.

loans.name: Shaif

texts.en:
Shaif is a 28-year-old married man who has one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He lives in a renowned area of the city. He has been operating a barber shop for five years. He started his business with a small piece of land where he opened a small barber shop.

He has known how to attract customers through the service that he provides them. His main customers are people living in his neighborhood and the local community. He works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.
 
Being an ambitious man, he would like to expand his business to provide his client's needs and get more profit. So he took a youth loan of 110,000 YER from AMB in order to buy barber chairs, mirrors, combs and creams for his business.

In the future, Shaif would like to provide a private school education for his child and expand his business to open a better barber shop also.

loans.use: to buy barber chairs, mirrors, combs and creams for his business.

loans.name: Lope

texts.en:
Lope is a hard-working entrepreneur who has operated a variety store business for the past eight years. She sells such items as snack foods, detergent, and soap. She earns additional income from selling coconut wine and from engaging in abaca weaving. 
 
She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as snack foods, detergent, and soap to sell in her store.

Lope has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items such as snack foods, detergent, and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Now requesting her fifth loan for Php 15,000, Elvira will use the money to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA and continues to provide her and her family with support that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 
Rolinda has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. Her husband is providing motorcycle services.She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rolinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Rolinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lucia  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 62 years old and married.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business hog raising in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been hog raising for 3 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Guillerma has a chocolate making business in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her chocolate making.

Guillerma has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chocolate making.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. She is single and has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy a manicure set and clothing.

Annabelle has been in this business for 20 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business and to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy a manicure set and clothing.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, age 52, is a hard-working entrepreneur who earns an income by making and selling brooms. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is still in school.

Alma has requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for broom-making.
 
Alma would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for broom-making

loans.name: Ana Lucila

texts.en:
Ana Lucila, age 49, operates a food shop or "carenderia," where she prepares and sells viands like adobo, bulalo, and halang-halang. She has had this business for 12 years. She and her husband have four children.

Ana Lucila has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands.

In the future, Ana Lucila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise, age 38, operates a retail business, selling milk. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within an estate near an urban area and her primary customers are the local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the milk-selling business. She has two children, ages three and five years old.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy milk to offer for sale. Her business goal is to run a milk bar retail business within five years. She describes herself as someone who loves her work.

loans.use: to buy additional litres of milk to offer for sale

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Richelle has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Richelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Richelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell

loans.name: Cecilla

texts.en:
This is Cecilla, 63, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Leandro, her business partner. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cecilla operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cecilla dreams to grow her business and secure her future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Marlyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. Her husband's name is Daniel and he works as a businessman. Emmy operates a café business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are neighbours. Emmy's other source of income includes tailoring and dressmaking business. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is food and rent bills. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Emmy will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil. Emmy aspires to establish a restaurant business in the future. She joined Yehu because of flexible policies and procedures.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Sheila has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Sheila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Sheila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, age 36, earns an income by selling fish, a business she has operated for over ten years. She earns approximately USD 15 per day. Her husband runs a business of charging batteries and renting sound equipment, and he earns approximately USD 5 per day. They have two children and the family lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

In order to improve her business, Chantha is requesting a loan of USD 800 in order to raise capital for purchasing more fish to offer for sale. This loan will enable her to generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to use any further profits to expand her business and to enable her children to obtain bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house so as to to make it bigger and stronger, allowing her to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital for purchasing more fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, age 40, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She and her husband have two children.
 
Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her shop.

In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Concejo

texts.en:
Concejo, age 47, operates a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have five children.

Concejo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

In the future, Concejo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Lynet

texts.en:
Lynet is a previous Kiva borrower who is requesting another Kiva loan in the amount of KES 40,000 in order to establish a new business of selling clothes. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to offer for sale. 

She dreams of purchasing a plot of land on which to build real estate houses in the future. 

Lynet offers her thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing an opportunity to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Pasencia

texts.en:
Pasencia, age 51, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. She also prepares and sells cooked viands for an additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.  
   
Pasencia lives with her husband Ferdinand in Dasmariñas, Cavite. Ferdinand works as a driver. They have four children and they manage their household while operating their respective businesses. Patencia is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Pasencia hopes to see her business grow in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members where she can share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran, age 30, earns an income by selling freshwater shells. She has been in her business for over 10 years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband runs a public transportation motor-taxi service and earns approximately USD 4 per day. They live with their three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Due to the fact that her husband's present motorcycle is old and unpredictable, Ran is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 800 in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband so that he can more effectively run his business. This purchase will enable her husband to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, Ran would like to rebuild her present house to make it stronger so as to provide better living conditions for the family. Her goal is to earn enough money to be able to enable her children to obtain bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband so that he can more effectively run his public transportation business

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden, age 23, operates a shop that sells spices, food seasonings, and vegetables. She has run this business for four years. She is unmarried.

Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of 7,000 in order to buy stocks of spices and vegetables to offer for sale.

In the future, Eden hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of spices and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn, age 45, earns an income by growing and selling mushrooms. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. They live with their three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Due to the family's difficulty in accessing transportation, Thoeurn is requesting a loan in the amount of USD 1500 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for commuting. This purchase will enable her to use the money saved on transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house, making it bigger and stronger so as to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to use for commuting

loans.name: Sedjrogande Group

texts.fr: SEDJROGANDE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sewlan Yvette Rébéca (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Charly. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec le mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Sewlan Yvette Rébéca vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans une ville du Benin. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la première fois que Sewlan Yvette Rébéca et les autres membres du groupe SEDJROGANDE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SEDJROGANDE is a three person group, whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Sewlan Yvette Rébéca (whose hand is raised on the photo) is 35 years old and married to a certain Charly. The couple has two children, all in school and under their care. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca stopped school at the secondary level. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca lives together with her children and her husband and takes care of the different household responsibilities together with her husband. 

For almost eight years, Sewlan Yvette Rébéca has been selling hair extensions and cosmetics in a town of Benin. Sewlan Yvette Rébéca gets her supplies in a market in Benin. This is the first time that Sewlan Yvette Rébéca and the other members of the SEDJROGANDE group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and better respond to the demands of their clientèle.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Janny Ondina Castro Rodriguez

texts.es:
Janny de 42 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, es comerciantes informal de ropa y relojes de mano. 
Comenzó con su esposo, para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a comprar mas mercadería como relojes y mas ropa. Para seguir con sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pantalones, zapatos para seguir con las ventas.
texts.en: Janny, 42, lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio, Guayaquil.  She’s an informal merchant selling wrist watches and clothes.  She started with her husband in order to support their two children and gradually managed to buy more merchandise like watches and more clothes.  To continue with her sales she wants to use the loan to buy pants and shoes to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants and shoes.

loans.name: Ana Claudia

texts.es: Ana  de 40 años vive ( machala ecuador ). Ella decidió entrar al negocio de la costura por motivo de que su espozo la abandono . ella le hacia ropa a sus hijos y entonces decidió sacar al publico ropa para vender. Ella trabaja con muchas ganas y esfuerzo para sacar a su familia adelante. A futuro ella desea tener una bootick y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios. Con el préstamo comprara ( tela hilos etc).
texts.en: Ana, 40, lives in Machala, Ecuador.  She decided to go into the business of tailoring because her husband abandoned her.  She would make clothes for her children and then decided to make clothes to sell to the public.  She works hard to move her family forward.  In the future she’d like to have a boutique and that her children finish their schooling.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and tools.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen Candelario Vera

texts.es: Maria de 43 años vive( Quevedo ecuador) . ella decidido  ponerse una tienda en su vivienda porque tubo una baja situación económica por ese motivo ella se puso ese negocio. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo todos los días sola . a futuro ella desea tener  su cas propia . Con el préstamo comprara (arroz aceite etc)
texts.en: María, 43, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She decided to open a store at home because her economic situation declined and that motivated her to start this business.  She works very hard every day by herself.  In future, she'd like to have a house of her own.  She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, snacks, candy and beverages.

loans.name: Karina Rossana

texts.es: Karina de 22 años vive (libertad ecuador) . ella decidió entrar al comercio de ropa para poder mejorara su situación económica. Comenzó vendiéndole a sus amistades. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja todos los días sin ayuda de nadie. A futuro ella anhela tener su familia y una buena casa. Con el préstamo comprara ( camisas, blusas, jeans etc).
texts.en: Karina, 22, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  She decided to go into clothes sales to improve her economic situation.  She started out selling to her acquaintances.  With much effort and dediation she works every day with no help from anyone.  In future, she'd like to have a family of her own and a good house.  She will use the loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, etc.

loans.use: to buy blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Alejandro Nelson Maridueya Monserrate

texts.es: Alejandro de 52 años vive (milagro ecuador) el decidió trabajar de conserje en una escuela . al ver que el dinero no le alcanzava para sustentar a su familia decidió vender bollos  le va bien. El trabaja solo todos los días como conserje y los fines de semana como bollero. A futuro el desea tener su familia junta ytener su negocio mejor. Con el préstamo comprara carnes, alquiler de local para picanteria.
texts.en: Alejandro, 52, lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  He decided to work as a caretaker at a school but seeing that the money was insufficient to support his family he decided to sell bollos [green plantain, peanuts and fish wrapped in a banana leaf]; he does well.  He works every day as a caretaker and on weekends as a bollo merchant.  In future, he'd like to have his family all together and to improve his business.  He will use the loan to buy meat and to rent a locale for his snack shop.

loans.use: to buy meat and pay rental on a locale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela makes and sells clothing to earn an income. She sells her clothes in a lucrative area and has been engaged in this business for two years. She describes herself as ambitious. She is unmarried with no children as yet. 

Pamela's business faces a challenge in that she has insufficient funds for purchasing necessary materials. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials for making clothes. She envisions her business expanding to be able to meet her all customers' needs. 

Pamela's primary dream is to secure a stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is taking out an additional Kiva loan in the amount of KES 20,000 to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she intends to purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale. 

The previous loan improved her business and she made additional profits which enabled her meet her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, age 50, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

In the future, Ester hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, age 48, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have five children.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 in order to buy stocks for the retail store and also to buy Avon and Natasha products to offer for sale.

In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the retail store and also to buy Avon and Natasha products to offer for sale

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El comité Mburucuya es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y que han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y también para sus familias. Son muy activas y reconocidas en el barrio por su unión y compañerismo.
Petrona es peluquera y nos comenta que se unió al grupo con mucha esperanza de salir adelante y para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ella dice que le va muy bien en el negocio, pues ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre acude a su local, y que gracias a esto ha podido ir creciendo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para su peluquería, como ser peines, ruleros, spray, gel, tintes y demás insumos. Ella agradece la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Mburucuya” committee in the city of San Lorenzo is composed of 17 very hardworking women who recognize in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program a great opportunity for progress for themselves and their families.  They are very active and recognized in their neighborhood for their unity and companionship.


Petrona is a barber and she comments that she joined the group very much hoping to get ahead and through teamwork be able to help each other out.  She says that she does very well in her business because she has a well-established regular clientele that always comes to her shop and thanks to this she’s been able to grow and improve her living conditions.


She requests the loan to buy supplies she needs for her shop like combs, rollers, spray, gel, coloring and other supplies.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 7 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que a pesar de sus adversidades mantienen su alegría,  laboran día a día en sus diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue declarada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cultural y natural. Su gente es de un corazón muy  cálido y mantienen la cultura de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Melva, tiene 38 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, dos de hijos estudian en el colegio y uno de sus hijos está trabajando y ayuda a la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Melva se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 3 años y labora solo días de ferias. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como: cerdos, pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una  vajilla y víveres para continuar con su negocio.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Nuevas Amigas” (New Friends) communal bank is composed of seven members who are hardworking, very tenacious women who despite their adversities maintain their cheerfulness.  They work every day in various activities that allow them to cover household expenses.  They live in various parts of the city of Cuenca, a city that was declared a Cultural Heritage of Humanity in December, 1999.  It has great architectural, cultural and natural beauty.  Its residents are very warmhearted and they preserve the cultures of its peoples.

One of the group members is Melva, 38.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 17, and 14 years of age.  Two of the children attend secondary school and one of them is working and helping out with the home’s economy.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and the house they live in is their property.

Melva has been selling food for the last three years.    She only works on market days.  At home se raises animals like pigs, chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in her community.

This is the first loan she’s had with the communal bank and will use it to buy a set of cooking pots and foodstuffs to continue with her business.  Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy a set of cooking pots and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mawuena Group

texts.fr: MAWUENA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Justine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Nestor. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Justine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Justine vend des condiments dans une ville du Benin. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  C’est la deuxième fois que Justine et les autres membres du groupe MAWUENA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAWUENA is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Justine (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 41 and married to a man named Nestor. They have three dependent children, all in school. Justine never went to school. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Justine has been selling condiments in a city of Benin for nearly eight years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and to meet the needs of their customers. The first loan was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Dorotea Hermelinda

texts.es:
Dorotea tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo y por los cuales da la vida con tal de verlos felices, junto a ellos vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, su agricultura, así como también la generosidad de sus pobladores. Dorotea es una mujer humilde y luchadora, ha trabajado anteriormente en el campo, con mucho sacrificio y ahorro logro tener su negocio de venta de gaseosa y dulces desde hace un año, pero también los fines de semana trabaja haciendo limpieza en una casa de playa, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios siempre está a su lado y la guía para salir adelante, asimismo tiene la mejor motivación que una persona puede tener que son sus hijas.

Dorotea está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios para poder exhibir sus gaseosas ya que actualmente las coloca en el piso, lo que le permitirá mostrar sus productos con mas orden y los clientes se sientas satisfechos, así aumentaran sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando día a día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Dorotea, 43, is the mother of four children who she loves very much and for whom she’d give her life to see them happy.  She lives with them in the city of Imperial, a city that is noted for its hot climate, its farming and also for the generosity of its inhabitants.  

Dorotea is a humble, tenacious woman who has worked in the fields in the past.  With sacrifice and saving she was able to acquire her own business selling soft-drinks and candy a year ago but on weekends she also works cleaning a beach house.  She believes that she does well in her business because God is always by her side and guides her forward.  She also has the best motivation any person could have: her daughters.

Dorotea is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy shelving to display her soft-drinks since she currently has to display them on the floor.  This will allow her to display her wares in a more orderly fashion and customers will feel satisfied thus her income will increase and she will continue to work day by day to reach her most important dream: “To provide her children with a good education and to have a restaurant.”

loans.use: to buy shelving.

loans.name: Simandokinto Group

texts.fr: SIMANDOKINTO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ayaba Jeanne Chantal (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Idelphonce. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de neuf ans, Ayaba Jeanne Chantal vend de maïs dans une région du Benin. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la première fois que Ayaba Jeanne Chantal et les autres membres du groupe SIMANDOKINTO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SIMANDOKINTO is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Ayaba Jeanne Chantal (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 43 years old and married to a man named Idelphonce. They have four dependent children, all in school. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal never went to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Ayaba Jeanne Chantal has been selling corn in a district of Benin for nearly nine years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Ayaba Jeanne Chantal and the other members of the group SIMANDOKINTO are seeking their first loan from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital, bolster their activities, and meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn for resale.

loans.name: Renan

texts.es: El Sr. Renán tiene 31 años no esta casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tienen 3 hijos que son 7,3 y 1 años, se dedica a la   agricultura  siembra papa y yuca, su parcela se  encuentra en la localidad de San Pedro, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Renán utilizara este préstamo para  la compra de semillas para  siembra de papa, Renán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizara los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, el Sr. Renán es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta a tempranas horas  de la mañana para dedicare se a su tierras, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señor Renán is 31 years old.  He is unmarried, but lives with his partner with whom he has three children aged 7, 3, and 1.  He works in agriculture, growing potatoes and yucca.  His parcel of land is located in the San Pedro area.

This loan is his third lending cycle with the financial institution, and Señor Renán will use this loan to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.  Renán faces challenges with his business in moving out of poverty, and will use his profits to improve his family's quality of life.

Señor Renán is a very hard-working person who gets up early in the morning to work his land.  He is happy and appreciative about the opportunity being provided to him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Isabel Margen

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad y juntos viven en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son “Las Líneas de Nazca”, son jeroglíficos extensos ubicados en la pampa de nazca y que según estudios eran una especie de calendario astronómico de la cultura nazca, asimismo esta ciudad posee un clima cálido en cualquier época del año. A Isabel le gusta ver televisión en sus tiempos libres así como también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos que es el riquísimo “Cau Cau”.

Isabel trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras, entre otros al cual le dedica alrededor de 10 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y es constante en su trabajo.

Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora y poder realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que contara con energía eléctrica y poder conservar de mejor manera los productos de su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Isabel, 27, is the mother of a little one-year-old boy; they live together in the city of Nazca, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions: The Nazca Lines, which are extensive hieroglyphics located in the Nazca plains and that according to some studies were a type of astronomic calendar of the Nazca culture.  This city also has hot weather year-round.  Isabel likes watching television in her free time as well as eating one of her favorite dishes which is the very delicious “Cau Cau” [tripe stew].

Isabel works in her business selling groceries, vegetables and others about ten hours daily.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s kind to customers and steadfast at work.

Isabel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to buy a freezer and to install electricity at home which will allow her to improve her quality of life because by having electricity she will be able to better store the products for her business and improve her income so that she can continue working toward her great dream: “To finish building her house.”

loans.use: to buy a freezer and to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000. With the loan, she wants to pay school fees for her children. The previous loan impacted her business and she made additional profits of 50 percent. She dreams of expanding to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina, 59, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and mother of five children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lina operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lina hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ana has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
