With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a fifty-three-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children who one of whom still attends school and the other who works. He’s the one taking care of his family and doing his best in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy costs of life. Elias began his own work as a furniture painter in 1976 and has already many years of experience in this domain. He has gained different clients from different areas especially because of his good and well organized work. 

Today, he’s seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business to be able to take more projects thus earn superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a forty-five-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children. Three of them are studying and the other is working. Ghassan is trying his best to be able to build a good future for his family and pay his children’s education fees. He has owned a computer shop since 2010. In parallel, he works as an independent constructor. 

Today, he’s looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop and change its decoration. This will allow him to attract added customers thus increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to enlarge his network by adding more computers to it.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and change its decoration.

loans.name: Furaha Mweni

texts.en:
Furaha is twenty-eight years old, married, and the father of one child. For the last two years, he has earned a living by providing transport services using his motorcycle to residents of Malindi town. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his third loan, for KES 70,000, in order to repair his motorcycle and purchase a dairy cow since he wants to venture into small-scale dairy farming. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to continue looking after his family and pay his child's school fees. Furaha intends to continue growing his business so that he may get to give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es: Ana Virginia de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de maíz y café, ya tiene algunos años de experiencia y ahora quiere acrecentar el negocio, pues últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela ya que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio que ofrece es inigualable. Ana es una mujer emprendedora siempre dispuesta a aprovechar las buenas oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que hay que ser fiel a las pequeñas cosas, porque en ellas nace tu fortaleza, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos necesarios para su negocio, semillas maíz, frijol, abono, entre otros. Ana Virginia tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Virginia, 44, lives with her children in her own house.  She works growing corn and coffee.  She has several years of experience and now she wants to expand the business.  Lately she has acquired a lot of customers because what she sells is of very good quality at very affordable prices.  Also, the service she offers is incomparable.

Ana is an enterprising woman who is always ready to make the most of the good opportunities that present themselves to her.  She thinks that you have to be true to the little things because that is where your strength comes from.  This is how she decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy the supplies necessary for her business: corn seed, beans, and fertilizer, among others.

Ana Virginia is confident that in this way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman. She has seven children and five are enrolled in school. Mbeyu operates a clothes selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Mbeyu's other source of income includes selling coconuts. She describes her greatest business challenge as competition and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbeyu will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. Mbeyu aspires to establish a stall selling clothes in the future. She joined Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a sixty-one-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He strives to work really hard to be able to fulfill his family needs. He started to work as a taxi driver in 1978 on a free-lance basis. He’s a good man and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 

Today, he’s in need of a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his car’s mechanical fees in addition to painting it. He notes that this will improve his work and allow him to transport his clients safely. In the future, he plans to enhance his work and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay his car’s mechanical fees in addition to painting it.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is thirty years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the last seven years, she has earned a living by selling various food stuffs in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 7,000. 

The client was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000, to buy an additional stock of fruits, vegetables, cooking flour, cooking oil and so on to sell to her customers. 

Mary will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees. Mary's goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she may help her family be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables, cooking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a thirty-six-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child who is still attending school. He collaborates with his wife who has been working in a local school since 2008 in order to enhance their way of living. As for Basel, he has owned a library for the past nine years. In parallel, he teaches in one of the local schools and has done for seven years. 

Today, he’s looking to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase stationary and books for his library. Definitely, this will develop his business and help him earn a superior income. In the future, he plans to focus on one job and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase stationary and books for his library.

loans.name: Glady's

texts.en:
Glady's is a fifty-year-old married woman. She has four children; one is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is James and he works as a farmer. Glady’s operates real estate houses and her potential customers are tenants. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are mostly tenants. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Glady's will use the KES 20,000 loan to establish a retail shop, and purchase stock of goods for sale at the shop. Glady's aspires to expand to other businesses in the future. She joined Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Kesiah

texts.en:
Kesiah is thirty-three years old and blessed with four children aged fifteen, twelve, eight and four. She sells charcoal, a business she started four years ago, and which earns her a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase charcoal for sale. The profit she earns from it will be ploughed back into her business. 

Her dream is to open up a boutique business and poultry farming at the same time. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a fifty-four-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s is the one taking care of the family and covering the heavy life expenses. Asaad started his own work in 1989. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanical tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more and additional customers. In the future, he plans to enlarge his garage and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical tools for his business.

loans.name: Indira Diana

texts.es: La Sra. Indira  tiene 25 años no esta casada pero convive con su pareja con el cual tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 5 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la  Venta de Verduras, vive en la zona 27 de Agosto, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  Indira va a utilizar este préstamo  para capital de trabajo y para la compra de verduras por mayor para surtir su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de ofertar mas productos para ofrecer a los clientes, la Sra. Indira enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, los problemas sociales y  utilizara los beneficios para  mejorar su puesto, la Sra. Indira es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Indira, 25, is not married but lives with her partner, with whom she has two children, ages 5 and 6.  She works selling vegetables.  She lives in the 27 de Agosto area.

This loan is her second loan sequence with the institution.  Indira is going to use this loan as working capital and to buy vegetables wholesale to supply her business.  The reason for requesting this loan is the need to offer more products to her customers.

Indira faces challenges in her business: competition and social problems.  Indira will use the profits to improve her stand.  Indira is a hardworking woman.  She is happy about and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is in the farming and motorcycle transport businesses with both proving income for her family upkeep. She has been in farming for five years and currently produces milk and pineapple for the local market. She is 38 years old with three children between 14 and 4 years old. All are already in school.

Rodah has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to expand her dairy capacity and thus, her income. She reckons the improved milk output will help meet her family's needs both for consumption and for resale to meet other basic needs.

She says Juhudi Kilimo loans have come as a rescue to farmers but indicates that lack of top up loans remains a challenge.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Muthenzi

texts.en:
Muthenzi is a fifty-eight year old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from nine to thirty. He describes himself as social and friendly. He operates a farm where he sells mangoes. He has been involved in this business for ten years and employs two staff members. His business is located near a busy tarmac road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of water in the area. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy mango seedlings and pesticides. Muthenzi's dream and business goal is to be distributing fruits to Nairobi using a van within five years.

loans.use: to buy mango seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is thirty-two years old, married, and the father of one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living by operating a retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of KES 30,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for KES 20,000, to purchase additional stock of cooking flour, cooking oil, soft drinks and so on to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to continue looking after his family as well as pay his child's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he may give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking flour, cooking oil and soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Héctor Antonio

texts.es: Héctor Antonio  de 46 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a las tareas del hogar y le ayuda en el negocio. Él se dedica  al comercio de tienda desde hace ya varios años. Ofrece variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, pastas, aceite, detergente, café, leche, bebidas, papel, y demás artículos que son atractivos para los clientes. Además posee un molino de nixtamal el cual atiende todos los días a la hora de que los clientes buscan su servicio ya que en el se puede moler variedad de semillas tales como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, café, etc. Tiene muy buenas referencias de sus clientes ya que para él es muy importante mantener satisfechos a los clientes puesto es la única forma de ser exitoso en los negocios. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en sus negocios principalmente en la compra de repuestos para su molino ya que con el uso las piezas se deterioran y necesitan ser reemplazadas para que el molino pueda funcionar de la mejor manera. Además también desea invertir en la compra de artículos de tienda (bebidas, churros, galletas, pan dulce, aceite, arroz, sopas, pastas, frijoles, etc.) para surtir su negocio y poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que logrará resultados favorables y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor Antonio is 46 years old and lives in his own home together with his partner in life, who dedicates her time to taking care of the household and who helps him in the business. For a number of years now he has earned his living by running a store. He offers a variety of convenience items, such as rice, pasta, detergent, coffee, milk, drinks, paper and more items that are attractive to his clients. Additionally, he owns a type of mill used to grind corn meal that he runs every day whenever his clients request the service. The mill can grind a variety of foods, including corn, rice, beans, coffee, etc. He has very good client references since for him it is very important to keep his clients satisfied given that it is the only way to be successful in business. 

Héctor Antonio made the decision to request this loan from Kiva's partner, Integral, in order to invest in his business, principally in the purchase of replacement parts for his mill. With use the mill parts deteriorate and need to replaced so that the mill can function optimally. He also wants to invest in the purchase of items for the store, including drinks, churros, cookies, pastry, oil, rice, soup, pasta and beans in order to better stock his business and be able to offer better service to his clients. He trusts in God that he will achieve favorable results and by doing so will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy drinks, churros, cookies, pastry, oil, rice, soup, pasta and beans to sell in his store, as well as replacement parts for his mill.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children and all are enrolled in school. Nyevu operates a business selling secondhand clothes and sells her goods from door to door and from home. She has worked in this business for one year. Nyevu's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expenses is food for the family and school fees. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Nyevu will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Nyevu aspires to establish another selling stall in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Doreen has a wedding shop that rents wedding dresses & accessories. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy materials for the maintenance of the wedding dresses.

Doreen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Doreen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of the wedding dresses

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a forty-four-year-old married woman. She has ten children and eight are enrolled in school. Patience operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Patience will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions. Patience aspires to establish another outlet in the future. She joined Yehu because of favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a thirty-six-year-old married woman. She has eight children and five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Stanley and he works as a farmer. Florence operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Florence will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions. Florence aspires to establish another outlet in the future. She joined Yehu because of availability of variety of loan products which meet client’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married, she is twenty-three years old and a mother of two children aged one and five. She owns a small retail shop, which has been in operation for a period of four years earning a monthly income of KES 3,000

She has borrowed her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. and wishes to use this amount to purchase one 50kg bag of sugar, one bag of rice (50kg), one carton of washing bar soap and two bales of wheat flour. 

The profits will be used to plough back into the business. Her dream is to prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase a 50kg bag of sugar, one bag of rice (50kg), one carton of washing bar soap and two bales of wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies such as beverages, rice, beans, oil, candy, paper, sweet bread, coffee, and other products.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
This is Patricia, 52, who is a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a mason, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Patricia operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Patricia hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en: Mwarabu is a 43-year-old married woman. She has three children and all are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Paul. Mwarabu operates a business selling secondhand clothes and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for one year and was previously employed as a cereals shop seller. Her primary customers are the neighboring community members. Mwarabu's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expenses are the electricity bills and clothing. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Mwarabu will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Mwarabu aspires to establish another stall to sell clothes in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Rahel is a forty-four-year-old married woman. She has three children and two are enrolled in school. Rahel operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Rahel will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of potatoes and onions. Rahel aspires to establish a grocery shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of its client-oriented products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a twenty-four year old married man. He has a son who is two years old. He describes himself as social and friendly. He operates a retail store where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a shopping centre and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cables and earth rods. His business goal is to run several similar electronics shops within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cables and earth rods.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is thirty-one years old. He is from Nakuru and is married to Tressy; they have two children who are between the ages of four and two.

Silas has a retail business that he has been doing for the past four years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy soap, margarine, sugar etc to add to his stock.
 
He hopes to open up a general wholesale in the near future.

loans.use: To buy soap, margarine and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman. She has six children and four are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Justus and he works as a driver. Jackline operates a grocery stall and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Jackline will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, carrots and onions. Jackline aspires to establish another outlet in the future. She joined Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, carrots and onions.

loans.name: Tereka

texts.en:
Tereka is a fifty-year-old business man, who lives in Juba Yei. He is married with seven children between the ages of twenty-six an two. Five of them go to school. 

Tereka runs a shop store business, and he has been in the business for three years. He has one employee. Tereka heard about Finance South Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market as well in the Radio advert. He is taking a loan of SDG 1,000 to purchase more items like sodas, sugar, some cosmetics and many others. In addition to this business, Tereka grows food items like, sweet cassavas, sorghum and many others as other source of income. 

In five years time, Tereka would like to hope to build a better house with the intention of renting it. His major challenges include home expenses and his low income rate.

Tereka says that he has a lot of appreciation for finance South Sudan because they have expanded the programme up to Yei and he says may God bless the company and may it grow.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sodas, sugar and some cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-two years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is married to Margaret, a farmer. They are blessed with four adult children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to start an irrigation system in his farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Adán

texts.es: Adán de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran  estudiando. Él se dedica al comercio de pan el cual produce en su casa y luego lo pone a la venta. Con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado mantener este negocio y gracias a su dedicación y empeño sigue recibiendo frutos de su panadería. Tiene más de 12 años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela que cada día lo prefieren más y dan buenas referencias de él y su negocio. El se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador lleno de sueños y metas las cuales poco a poco ha venido logrando. Una de sus grandes sueños es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones a las que él ha tenido y es por eso que trabaja duramente para poder dar el estudio a sus hijos ya que solo de esta forma logrará  cumplir su sueño dando a sus hijos una herramienta excelente para defenderse por sí solos.  Esto lo ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria (harina, azúcar, leche, canela, colorantes, margarina, etc.) para incrementa su oferta con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos, de tal forma que pueda lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en: Adán is 42 years old and lives in his own home together with his 4 children, all of whom are currently in school. He makes his living selling bread he bakes in his house and later offers for sale. With a lot of effort he has succeeded in maintaining this business. Thanks to his dedication and determination he continues to earn a profit from his bakery. He has worked in this business for more than 12 years. As a result, he now boasts many clients. who prefer his product more every day and give good references about both him and his business. He distinguishes himself as a hardworking man full of dreams and goals that he has gone along achieving one by one. One of his greatest dreams is to see his children living in better conditions than he has experienced. With that goal in mind he works hard in order to give his children an education, since only by doing so will he fulfill his dream of giving his children an excellent tool with which to support themselves independently. That dream has motivated him to request this loan from Kiva's partner, Integral, in order to invest in his business by buying the raw materials (flour, sugar, milk, cinnamon, colorants, margarine, etc.) necessary to offer more baked goods to his clients. His aim in doing so is to meet more client demand, which in turn will allow him to increase both his sales and his income so that he can achieve his objective and give his family better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk, cinnamon, colorants, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a 32 year-old married woman. She has five children and four are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kea and he works as a driver. Kanze operates a coconut selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kanze will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell. Kanze aspires to establish a wholesale shop for selling coconuts in the future. She joined Kiva partner Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: James Munuku

texts.en: James is a 38 year-old married man. He has five children and four are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Margaret and she is a businesswoman. James operates a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business and sells his goods from home to the market. He's worked in this business for three years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. James will use the Kes 35,000 loan to service his motorcycle and purchase spare parts. James aspires to open a new business in the future. He joined  Kiva partner Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has one four year old child.  She has no additional dependents which live with her.

In 2010, Fatmata established her plastic, rubber and glass plate business. She began her business after she completed her diploma in business management and even though she tried hard to find a job she could not. She then decided to establish her own business.  With the experience she has and the qualification, she concluded that she can grow faster so she requested some amount of money from her husband to start her business. 

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy 50 set pans @ 24,000,40, flax @ 30,000 and 38 sets cool man @ 67,000 and the balance will be used to pay for transportation.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 963,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand the business and also hope to see her child educated to a higher level. Hard working and very dedicated to business, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy materials for her plastic, rubber and glass plate business and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Wesley Lagat

texts.en: Wesley is a 36 year-old married man. He has two children aged two and four and both are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Kendi and she works as a shopkeeper. Wesley operates a retail shop business and sells his goods retail. He's worked in this business for six years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Wesley will use the Kes 40000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. Wesley aspires to open a new business in the future. He joined Kiva partner Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 41 year-old married woman. She has eight children and five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Francis and he works as a farmer. Mary operates a vegetable stall and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mary will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell. Mary aspires to open a new business in the future. She joined Kiva partner Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts to resell.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba tiene 22 años de edad, se considera una mujer muy alegre y responsable en sus actividades. Alba vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Alba trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos blancos, este negocio le permite ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar y también es una fuente económica para sustentar los gastos de sus estudios. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, este crédito va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo macho para reproducción y seguir con el negocio.

Alba sueña con ser una profesional y una buena microempresaria.
texts.en:
Alba is 22 years old. She is considered to be a cheerful woman who is responsible in her activities. Alba lives with her parents in the city of Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province.

Alba works alone in raising white pigs. This business enables her to help her parents with the household expenses and serves as a source of financial income to pay for her education costs. This is the first time she has worked with FODEMI. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of a male pig for breeding purposes, which will help to continue her business.

Alba dreams of becoming a professional and a successful micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a male pig for breeding.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 39 years-old and married with four children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. She describes her customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings in order to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is aged 38 and has engaged in active farming for the last twelve years.  She currently employs one farmhand and produces maize, milk and beans for the local market.  She is married with one child aged twelve.  Her husband is a teacher who gets additional income to supplement her farming income.

Mercy has made a loan request with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 45,000 KES in order to buy piglets. She says a pig business will help improve her family living standards. She also plans to build rental houses which she believes is the investment that will secure her future.

Mercy says high costs of labour, intermitent crop success and poor markets remain the leading cause of business farming failures.  She also laments the high costs of capital.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Justus M'mugaa

texts.en:
Justus is a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya.  He is aged 59 and married with three adult children. He runs a retail shop in the local market and operates as a broker of coffee.  That means he sources coffee from small scale produces and sells to processing factories.  His farm produces mainly coffee and bananas.

Justus has requested a third loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry birds.

(He is pictured with a bicycle in the backround which should not be confused for a transport business). 

He wants to expand coffee and banana plantations and hopes to improve the family living standards and venture into dairy farming in the future.

He laments the shortage of rains and high costs of inputs like fertilizers.  He compliments Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo for improvement of service delivery.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man.  His four children are all studying. He’s their main source of income and the one covering their study fees. He has had his own business as an electrician since year 2000. His work consists of setting and installing home electricity. He works upon request on a free-lance basis. Today, he asks for a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to buy a scanner machine for his business. This will definitely develop his work, and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to improve his work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a scanner machine for his business

loans.name: Diana Tamara

texts.es:
Diana Tamara tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos de 6 años y 1 año de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Diana se dedica a la agricult5ura a la siembra de cacao Además se dedica a realizar quehaceres domésticos.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar plantas de cacao, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar las plantas y los insecticidas. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. 

El sueño es poder seguir adelante y sembrar más hectáreas de cacao.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades de los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Diana Tamara is 24 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. She lives with her partner and children (ages 6 and 1) in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Diana is a member of the February 25th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Guabito in Zapotal parish and is part of the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in agricultural work.

Diana is a farmer who grows cacao. She also devotes time to the household chores. Diana is requesting a loan to buy cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid nutrients. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy plants and insecticides. She buys and sells in Ventanas.

Her dream is to continue forward and have more hectares of cacao to raise. The challenges she faces include dealing with her children's illnesses. In her free time, Diana enjoys spending time with her family.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid nutrients.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with four children and all her children are in school. She takes care of an additional family member (sister).

She has a cosmetics shop at the market and she sells her products on a retail basis. She also sells cold drinks. She has been in business for the last six years .She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO in order to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. 

Her major business challenges are defaulters and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. Her goals and aspirations are to own a  fully stocked cosmetics shop and to build rental rooms. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en:
Hakim is a 36 year old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married with seven children between the ages of 18 and five years.  Five of them go to school. 

Hakim runs a shop store business and he has been in the business for eight years.  He has one employee. Hakim heard about Kiva partner Finance South Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market as well in Radio adverts. He is taking a loan of 1,000 in order to purchase more items such as sodas, beer, sugar, cosmetics and many other items.  In addition to this business, Hakim has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Hakim would like build better houses in his plot for rent.  

His major challenges include a low income rate and home expenses.

Hakim says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sodas, beer, sugar, cosmetics and many others items.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She takes care of two additional family members (brother’s children).  She sells dried fish at the market. She has poultry as her other source of income. She has been in business for the last 4 months. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of dried fish.

Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level, and she also wants to do fish-smoking. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more more baskets of dried fish

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en: Zouheir is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, one of whom works while the other still attends school. Zouheir believes that combining forces with the rest of his family will be great to develop their way of living. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1992. His accuracy and honesty make his customers loyal to him. Zouheir is now looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen S.a.l to perform necessary maintenance on his car. This will help him target a wider range of people and increase his earnings. In the future, Zouheir plans to buy a minivan to transport more people.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his car

loans.name: Mery Margarita Gonzalez Parrales

texts.es: Mery de 46 años  vive ( paraíso Guayaquil). Ella decidio vender almuerzos debido  a que quería mejorar su situación económica. A parte ella se dedica a el arte de belleza. Con mucho esfuezo y dedicacion  trabaja todos los días  sola haciendo almuerzos y cuando tiene tiempo a la belleza que le realiza a sus clientes mujeres. A futuro ella anhela tener su casa bien arregalda por sus hijos . con el préstamo comprara ( material de mejoramiento de vivienda) ya que quiere mejorar el lugar donde hace la comida comprando cemento, arena, bloque.
texts.en: Mery is 46 years old and lives in Paraíso Guayaquil.  She makes her living selling prepared meals, as she wants to improve her economic situation.  Besides this, she offers beauty services.  With a lot of effort and dedication, she works every day alone preparing meals and when she has time, she provides beauty services to her female customers.  In the future, she aspires to have her house fixed up for her children.  With this loan she will buy materials to improve her apartment, since she wants to improve the place where she prepares food, by buying cement, sand and bricks.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Athumani Mwaduna

texts.en:
Athumani is a 30-year-old married man. He has 3 children who are all enrolled in school. His wife, Mwanajuma, works as a businesswoman. Athumani's highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water.

Athumani has operated a retail shop business for 1 year and his primary customers are local residents. Athumani will use this KES 40,000 loan to add more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale. Athumani hopes to open a new business in the future. He joined Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to add more stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 10 and 24 years old. Elizabeth describes herself as a consistent woman. She has operated a retail business selling clothes for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a conducive area and her primary customers are local residents. Elizabeth describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes. Elizabeth's dream and business goal is to expand her clothing sales business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Daima

texts.en:
Daima is a married woman. She has 5 children, and 2 are enrolled in school. Daima operates a food stall and fruit juice business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Daima will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase maize flour and ingredients for making juices. Daima aspires to open a new business in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and ingredients for making juices.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a married woman. She has a child who is 4 months old. Aziza operates a retail shop business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby.  Aziza's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high and low seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Aziza will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase beans, rice, maize and sugar for resale. Aziza aspires to open a new business in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, maize and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Leyla Isabel

texts.es: La señora Leyla, mujer luchadora de 52 años de edad, agradece a Dios  por la bendicion de tener dos empleos, que le generan mejores condiciones de vida para ella y sus familiares, siendo estos mismos su principal fuente de ingresos. Afodenic ha dado la oportunidad a leyla para ella poder hacer las mejoras a su vivienda e incrementos a su negocio. El objetivo que se lograra con este nuevo financiamiento es la puesta de piso y pared de fondo de su casa, en la cual requerira el uso de los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, bloques, piedrin, hierro, alambre de amarrar, ceramica, porcelana, separadores y otros. Su plan a futuro es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Leyla is a determined woman who is 52 years of age. She thanks God that she is blessed to have two employees who generate better living conditions for her and her family members since they help provide her main source of income. AFODENIC has given Leyla the opportunity to make improvements to her home and expand her business.

Her goal for this new loan is to install a floor and to build a wall at the back of her house. This requires the following construction materials: cement, blocks, gravel, iron, wire, ceramic tile, porcelain tile, dividers, and other items. Her plan for the future is to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for installing a floor and building a wall.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 4 months and 8 years. Her husband, Hamadi, works as a fish supplier. Mwanamisi's highest monthly expense is school fees for her children. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

Mwanamisi has operated a dumplings and flat bread business for 2 years, selling her goods from home. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi's other source of income is her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high and low seasons. Mwanamisi will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. Mwanamisi hopes to establish a tailoring business in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia vive en la zona del plan 3000 en la casa de su hermana, tiene un hijo de 1 año, su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería. Ella tiene una venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio. El crédito que están solicitando es para comprar fideos, harina, verduras, carne, frutas, hortalizas, sodas, bebidas  para surtir más su venta ya que por donde viven hay un mercado nuevo y quieren tener más mercadería para la venta para tener una mejor atención a sus clientes. La Sra. Silvia es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposo tienen el deseo de superación para brindarle un futuro a su hijo, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Siliva lives at her sister’s house in the Plan 3000 District. She has a one-year-old son and her husband is a locksmith. Silvia has a grocery store in her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy noodles, flour, greens, meat, fruit, vegetables, sodas, and beverages to increase her inventory. A new market opened where she lives, so she wants to have more merchandise to sell so that she can provide better service to her customers. Sra. Silvia and her husband are hardworking people who want to succeed so that they can provide a future for their son. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila Esperanza tiene 52 años de edad es divorciada tiene 3 hijos, vive con la madre y los hijos de 32, 29, 25 años de edad en ventanas provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Zoila se dedica a la realizar quehaceres domésticos. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales como cerdos, pollos y alimento como balanceado y polvillo.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar animales para poder criarlos y venderlos a un buen precio. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
El sueño es poder  tener un negocio propio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la falta de dinero para poder tener un negocio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicar tiempo a los nietos.
texts.en:
Zoila Esperanza is 52 years old. She is divorced and has 3 children. She lives with her mother and her children, aged 32, 29 and 25, in Ventanas in the province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the "25 DE FEBRERO" ["February 25"] communal bank, which is located in the area of Guabito in Zapotal parish, in the canton of Ventanas. The members work in agriculture.

Zoila dedicates herself to her domestic tasks. She is requesting the loan to buy animals such as pigs and chickens, as well as feed such as balanced commercial feed and rice bran. 

With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy animals so that she can raise them and sell them at a good price. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. Her dream is to have a business of her own. The challenge she faces is the lack of money to have a business. 

In her free time, she likes to spend time with her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy animals such as pigs and chickens, as well as feed such as balanced commercial feed and rice bran.

loans.name: Agele

texts.en:
Agele is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba Yei. He is married and has a 6-month-old child. 

Agele has operated a kiosk store business for 4 years.  He has no employees and no other source of income. Agele heard about Finance South Sudan from the loan officer’s promotion done in the market and through radio advertisements. Agele is taking out a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase more items such as bread, sodas, beers, sugar, cosmetics, etc.

In 5 years' time, Agele hopes to expand the business from a kiosk to a real shop. His major challenges include low income rates and home expenses. Agele says that he has a lot of appreciation for Finance South Sudan for supporting him with additional capital for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bread, sodas, beers, sugar, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members (orphans). Mayi has operated a retail business for the last 10 years, selling air time. She works seven days a week and generates additional income by selling necklaces.

Mayi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more air time. Her major business challenges are defaulters and competition. Mayi's goals and hopes are to start selling secondhand bags and clothes and to become a sales agent. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Mayi's major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more air time for resale

loans.name: Yehya

texts.en: Yehya is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four children. Two of them are still attending school while the others are working. After finding it hard to cover his children’s educational fees plus his family expenses, he decided to double his effort and take more projects, as he works on a free-lance-basis. He started his own business as a painter in 1992. Today, he wants a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l, to a buy more paint in order to be able to start his new project or else he won’t be capable to carry on his work properly.  In the future, he plans to open his own paint shop.

loans.use: to a buy more paint

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 24-year-old married woman. Her husband's name is Stephen and he works as an electrician. Dorcas operates a beauty salon business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Dorcas's other source of income includes her husband's contribution. She describes her greatest business challenge to be credit facilities and competition, and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Dorcas will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase chemicals, hair weaves, and hair extensions. Dorcas aspires to establish another beauty salon business in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, hair weaves, and hair extensions.

loans.name: Bertha Aurelia

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 41 años, se describe como una persona muy responsable en su trabajo. Bertha vive con su esposo e hijo en los alrededores de la ciudad de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi.

Bertha trabaja sola en la crianza de vacas para producción de leche, es la primera vez que realiza un crédito en Fodemi el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de una ternera para su crianza y dedicarse a la producción de leche, debido a que este negocio es una fuente de ingresos importante en su hogar ya que deben sustentar los gastos de alimentación, estudio de su hijo.

Bertha sueña con superarse cada día más y ver a su hijo profesional.
texts.en:
Bertha is 41 years old. She is described as a person who is very responsible in her work. Bertha lives with her husband and son on the outskirts of the city of Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province.

Bertha works alone in raising cows for milk production. This is the first time she has received a loan from FODEMI and she will invest in the purchase of a female calf to raise for the purpose of milk production. It should be mentioned that this business is an important source of household income that helps to pay for their food costs and the education of her son.

Bertha dreams of succeeding more each day and seeing her son become a professional.

loans.use: to buy a female calf.

loans.name: Reinelda Serena

texts.es:
REINELDA SERENA tiene 57 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 6 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 25 DE FEBRERO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Guabito de la parroquia Zapotal, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

 REINELDAse dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de banano, además tiene una mini tienda y realiza quehaceres domésticos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar plantas de banano, abonos, fertilizantes, líquidos para las plagas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar la siembra de banano.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas. El sueño es poder  trabajar y quedar bien con los pagos del crédito y hacerse otro mucho más grande.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y la competencia. En la familia la enfermedad de los hijos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar y cantar.
texts.en:
REINELDA SERENA is 57 years old. She has a common-law husband and 6 children. She lives with her partner and children in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the "25 DE FEBRERO" ["February 25"] communal bank, which is located in the area of Guabito in Zapotal parish, which is in the canton of Ventanas. Its members work in agriculture. 

REINELDA works in agriculture, growing bananas. She also has a mini-store and takes care of the domestic chores. 

She is requesting the loan to buy banana plants, compost, fertilizers and liquids to combat pests. With the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her banana plantings. 

She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. Her dream is to keep working, make her payments as scheduled and take out a much larger loan. 

The challenges she is faces are the plant pests and the competition. Within the family, it is illness among her children. 

In her free time, she likes to dance and to sing.

loans.use: to buy banana plants, compost, fertilizers, and liquids to combat pests.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 33-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s their main support; they all depend on him, especially to pay their educational fees in addition to all other family expenses. Hasan has been working in construction for the past twelve years. He also works as a taxi driver. Hasan is now looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new construction supplies such as wood, metal and many other items in order to develop his work. In the future, he plans to do bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase new construction supplies such as wood, metal and many other items

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 4 children between the ages of 4 months and 17 years, 3 of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Karisa, works as a butcher shop operator. Medza's highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

For the past 2 years, Medza has operated a fish sales business, selling her goods in a shop. She was previously employed as a prawn fish seller. Medza's primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Medza's other source of income is her husband's contribution. Medza describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to establish a fish selling stall and purchase bundles of fish. Medza hopes to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to establish a fish selling stall and purchase bundles of fish.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es: Maria,casada, mujer perseverante, y  con una familia a quien apoyar ; continua con su negocio de pulperia y venta de tortillas; contando siempre con el apoyo moral e ingreso extra que le genera su esposo, por otra parte expresa la señora que gracias a la oportunidad de confianza dada por  kiva y la micro-financiera, ha podido salir adelante. En esta ocasión su deseo a alcanzar con este nuevo credito es invertir en una variedad de productos tales como: arroz, frijol, aceite, carbon,maiz, papel higienico, pasta dental entre otros, mismos que le ayudaran a obtener mejores ventas y ganancias, y de esta forma tambien aumentar el numero de sus clientes. En un futuro su anhelo es llegar a tener un negocio mas solido y ofrecerles a sus familiares mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Maria is married and a determined woman with a family to support. She is continuing with her business, operating a neighborhood store and selling tortillas, always with the moral support and additional income generated by her husband. At the same time, she says that thanks to the opportunity and confidence given to her by Kiva and the microfinance institution, she has been able to get ahead. On this occasion, her goal for this new loan is to invest in a variety of products such as rice, beans, cooking oil, charcoal, corn, toilet paper, and toothpaste, among other items. These will help her to increase her sales and her earnings, and also to increase her number of customers. For the future, her hope is to expand her business so it is more solid, and offer her family members better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her store.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. Sylvia has operated a retail business for 7 years, selling passion fruits at the market. She works six days a week. Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of passion fruits. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing price of passion fruits. Her goals and hopes are to expand into the wholesale business, build her own home and educate her children up to university. Sylvia lives in a rented house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passion fruits

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 34-year-old married man. He has 4 children between the ages of 5 and 13 years, all enrolled in school. His wife, Agnes, works as a clothes seller. Samson's highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has both electricity and piped water.

Samson has operated a clothing sales business for 3 years, selling his goods in a shop. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Samson describes his greatest business challenge to be competition. Samson will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He hopes to expand his business and open another shop in the future. Samson joined Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alvaro Mauricio Hidalgo Quesada

texts.es: Álvaro, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra repuestos para realizar la reparación de su motocicleta. Lo que quiere es poder comprar las mejores repuestos y de buena calidad para que su motocicleta no le dé desperfectos a corto plazo y así poder cumplir con su trabajo de una forma más adecuada y eficiente. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Álvaro, 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife who is his greatest priority. With the loan he hopes to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He wants to be able to buy the best parts that are good quality so that his motorcycle doesn't break down in the short run. In this way he can carry out his work more adequately and efficiently. It's the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had previous loans with state banks in the past, but Fudecosur has given him the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Faxant

texts.en: Faxant is a 43-year-old married man. He has five children between the ages of 6 months and 20 years old and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Agnes and she works as a businesswoman. Faxant operates as a shopkeeper and sells his goods in a shop. He has worked in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are his neighbors and passersby. He describes his greatest business challenge to be seasonality and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Faxant will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereals, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Faxant aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with one child who is in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members .She sells tablecloths door- to –door. She sells her products both at retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last seven years .She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of materials and threads. Her major business challenges are thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to get a shop to sell her tablecloths. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of material and thread

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo se considera una persona sociable, alegre, cariñosa, amable, honesto y sobre todo muy trabajador. Segundo vive con su esposa y sus ocho hijos en Salcedo que se encuentra a diez minutos de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi.

Segundo trabaja con su esposa en la crianza y venta de cerdos, negocio el cual empezó  con un cerdito y mediante ha ido pasando el tiempo ha ido incrementando sus animales. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2009, el actual crédito es para la compra de cerdos para reproducción y balanceado para la alimentación de los mismos, esta inversión permitirá a Segundo seguir en el negocio e incrementar sus ventas, mejorando su calidad de vida.

Segundo sueña con tener criaderos grandes de cerdos y pollos para ser distribuidor mayoritario.
texts.en:
Segundo considers himself a sociable, happy, caring, nice, honest, and above all, hardworking person. He lives with his wife and their eight children in Salcedo, which is located ten minutes from Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.

Segundo works with his wife raising and selling pigs, a business which he began with one small pig and by means of which he has has increased the number of his animals through time. He has worked with Fodemi since 2009. The current loan is to buy pigs for reproduction and also animal feed with which to feed them. This investment will allow Segundo to continue with his business and increase his sales, improving his quality of life.

Segundo dreams of having large pig and chicken farms in order to be a principal distributor.

loans.use: to buy pigs for reproduction and animal feed with which to feed them.

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.en: Abdel Kader is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. His childrenn are attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 13 years and he specializesd in painting. In 2009, he opened his own painting shop. He is the main income provider of his family and always working hard to be able to pay the heavy living expenses, especially his children's school fees. Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase painting tools and supplies. He is sure that the loan will help him develop his business, which will return a higher income..

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Ravasco Mangi

texts.en: Ravasco is a 44-year-old married man. He has seven children between the ages of 3 and 17 and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Dama. Ravasco operates a charcoal business and sells his goods in a shop and from home. He's worked in this business for four years. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Ravasco's other source of income includes firewood selling. He describes his greatest business challenge to be competition and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ravasco will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Ravasco aspires to establish a secondhand clothes selling business in the future. He joined Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 46-year-old married man. He has five children between the ages of 3 and 21, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife’s name is Anna. Christopher operates a charcoal-selling business and sells his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Christopher’s other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge as competition, and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has electricity but no running water. Christopher will use the 20,000 KES loan to start another business, purchasing cereals of maize, rice, and wheat to sell. Christopher aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital to boost his business.

loans.use: to start another business, purchasing cereals of maize, rice, and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members .She sells secondhand shoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years .She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand shoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling secondhand bags and clothes. She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 24-year-old married man. He has one child. His wife's name is Hadija. Thomas operates a charcoal and sells his goods in a shop. He has worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are his neighbors and passersby. Thomas' other source of income includes a vegetable selling business. He describes his greatest business challenges to be seasonality and competition. His highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Thomas will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal. Thomas aspires to establish another shop to sell charcoal in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en: Sonnie lives in the Airport Community. She is married with seven children between 10 and 32 years old. For the past 15 years, she has been selling  charcoal in her community. Sonnie says she spends most of her time with her business since her business is in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras,ella vende zanahorias,cebollas,tomates,pepinos entre otras verduras,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas,zanahorias,tomates y pepinos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues to work selling vegetables.  She sells carrots, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables.  She sells from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  With this business she is bringing up her children.  Her dream is to expand her vegetable selling business.  The partner is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers. The partner is happy about the loan and commits to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: the partner is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers wholesale.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin 1 Group

texts.fr: DAGBEGNIKIN 1 est un groupement composé de onze personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Rosalie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Rosalie est  mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Epiphane. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Rosalie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Rosalie vend des condiments, des conserves et des poissons fumés dans un marché du Bénin. Rosalie s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Rosalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEGNIKIN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Dagbegnikin 1” is a group composed of 11 individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Rosalie (raising her hand in the photo) is 44 years old. Rosalie is married to Epiphane, a driver. They have three dependent children, all in school. Rosalie lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. Rosalie didn’t go to school. In order to support herself, Rosalie sells condiments, canned food and smoked fish at one of the Benin markets. Rosalie stocks up in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business and becoming more competitive on the market, Rosalie, together with the other members of the “Dagbegnikin 1” group, is seeking her third credit from ALIDé. Their two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food, condiments and fish.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married, and her husband is a teacher. They have two children, ages 5 and 9, both of whom are currently in school and living at home. For the past 7 years, Julie has been selling used clothes in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her future plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fodé Kandioura

texts.fr: Monsieur  Fodé Kandioura est un jeune homme de 30 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et est maçon de profession. En meme temps il exerce le commerce  et la vente d’ordinateurs, de téléviseurs, de portables et de scooters. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité qu’il a choisie par amour du business. Il est plutôt attiré  par les retombées financières qui découlent de son activité.  Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’équipement d’une nouvelle salle de jeux qu’il vient d’acquérir. Son objectif est de réussir son opération afin d’augmenter ses revenus réguliers et de pouvoir mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses proches.
texts.en: Fodé Kandioura is a 30-year-old man who lives in Senegal.  He is married and he is a mason by profession.  At the same time, he also works in retail and sells computers, televisions, mobile phones and scooters.  He has a five-year experience working in this field, which he chose because he loves the business.  He is rather attracted by the profits arising from his activity.  He is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which he will use to equip a new game room that he has just purchased.  His goal is to succeed in this business and get a regular income, which will enable him to better provide for himself and for his relatives.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a game room.

loans.name: Tania María

texts.es:
